analyzed: klu'i bu 'di dge ba'i @288b rtsa ba 'dis bskal pa brgya'i bar du log par ltung bar mi 'gyur te /

original: rab tu byung nas slob dpon med pa dang man ngag med par byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos mngon sum du gyur te rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon sum du byas nas rang sangs rgyas smon lam legs par btab pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te🔽/ 'di ni /

analyzed: de'i sbyin par bya ba'i chos yin no //// sengge zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'di lus srul pos brlams pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'di ni / sems can lto na 'dug pa de'i mthu yin te / sems can de nam btsas pa de'i tshe 'di'i skyon de med par 'gyur ro //

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: tu khyim de thog thag tu phyi sa'i dris gang bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as he was born, the entire house was filled with the smell of feces.

original: de nas bud med de dag gis spos sna tshogs kyis byugs te mal du bzhag kyang de'i lus las phyi sa'i dri med par ma gyur nas chung mas sde dpon sengge la bu de bstan par mi 'dod pa las bud med gzhan dag gis de la bsnyad de
analyzed: de nas bud med de dag gis spos sna tshogs kyis byugs te mal du bzhag kyang de'i lus las phyi sa'i dri med par ma gyur nas chung mas sde dpon sengge la bu de bstan par mi 'dod pa las bud med gzhan dag gis de la bsnyad de

analyzed: / jo bo khyod kyi sras ni /
translated: “Lord, your son

analyzed: mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan pa /

analyzed: lus thog thag nas phyi sa'i dri byung ste / des khyim thog thag phyi sa'i dris gang bar gyur to //
translated: The smell of feces comes from his body

translated: and has filled the entire house with the smell of feces.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu sde dpon sengge shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu sde dpon sengge shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur te /

original: des bsam pa /
analyzed: des bsam pa /

analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bu btsas su zin kyang 'di kho na ltar skyon can du gyur na /

original: bu 'di lta bu bdag la ci dgos kyi /
analyzed: bu 'di lta bu bdag la ci dgos kyi /
translated: What use do I have for such a son?

analyzed: mun sros pa'i 'og tu khyim nas byung ste khyi rnams la sbyin no snyam mo //

analyzed: de nas de'i bar skabs su sde dpon sengge dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das dang phrad nas bden pa rnams mthong ste /

analyzed: des bden pa rnams mthong nas bsam pa /
translated: Having seen the truths, he thought,

original: sems can 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni /
translated: “This being

analyzed: las las skyes te /

original: 'on kyang tshe rabs gzhan du lus 'di lta bur skye bar mi 'gyur ro snyam @289b nas 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khus gsos nas de cher skyes pa dang / phas de la smras pa /

translated: But in other lives, I will not be born with a body like this.” He raised him on milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and when he grew up, his father said to him,

original: bu / khyod sngon gyi las mi dge ba rnams kyis lus 'di lta bur skyes la /
analyzed: bu / khyod sngon gyi las mi dge ba rnams kyis lus 'di lta bur skyes la /
translated: “Son, because of your nonvirtuous actions in the past, you were born with a body like this.

original: da ltar bcom ldan 'das 'di ni /
analyzed: da ltar bcom ldan 'das 'di ni /
translated: Now, this Blessed One

analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing rkang gnyis pa yin te / 'di la ni /
translated: is a field of merit for humans.🔽If you do even a little service to him,🔽the result will be great, and the benefit will be great.

analyzed: bkur sti cung zad cig byas kyang 'bras bu chen po zhing phan yon che bar 'gyur gyis; de la bkur sti byos la smon lam legs par thob cig dang / khyod kyis las de yang bar 'gyur yang srid do //
translated: So serve him and make excellent aspirations, and it is possible that your karma will be reduced.”

analyzed: zhes byas nas des kyang pha'i ngag mnyan te sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la bkur sti byed pa la zhugs so //
translated: He listened to his father’s words and began to serve the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: de nas phyi zhig na khye'u des pha ma la gsol te sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge 'dun khyim du spyan drangs nas bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs nas bshos gsol zin te /🔽gsang sder ni /🔽gyu / phyag ni /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na khye'u des pha ma la gsol te sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge 'dun khyim du spyan drangs nas bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs nas bshos gsol zin te / gsang sder ni / gyu / phyag ni /
translated: Then one day the young man invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha to his home. He satisfied them with many good, wholesome foods, and after they had eaten, he took a very low seat and sat before the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.🔽When he saw that the Blessed One had finished eating and that his bowl had been taken away and his hands washed,

analyzed: bcabs par rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig khyer te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: he took a very low seat and sat before the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chung nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /🔽des na khye'u des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du @290a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chung nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te / des na khye'u des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du @290a *//
translated: The Blessed One directly apprehended his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, and taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
translated: As he listened to the Dharma, the young man destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where he sat.🔽“

original: des bden pa mthong nas bsam pa /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas bsam pa /
translated: He saw the truth and thought,

original: gal te bdag lus 'di lta bur ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag lus 'di lta bur ma gyur na ni /
translated: “If I had not been born with this kind of body,

analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas chu bo rnams las rgal bar bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad par bya ba zhig na snyam du sems pa dang /
translated: I would have gone forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, and I would have striven, practiced, and exerted myself in order to cross the floodwaters and go beyond the bonds.”

analyzed: sems bskyed ma thag tu khye'u de'i byad bzhin mi sdug pa de dang dri mi zhim pa de med par gyur to //
translated: As soon as he had this thought, the boy’s ugly face and foul smell disappeared.

original: de nas de lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: de nas de lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' ba skyes te /
translated: He became even more devoted to the Blessed One.

analyzed: de dga' ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: With devotion in his heart, he bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to him,🔽“Blessed One, I have seen the truth.

analyzed: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /

analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: May I too practice pure conduct in the Blessed One’s presence.”🔽The Blessed One then said to him, “Come, join me, monk!”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /

analyzed: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: With diligence, practice, and effort, he cast away all afflictive emotions and manifested arhatship.

analyzed: de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar @290b mnyam pa /

analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: and his mind was as level as the surface of the earth.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: He was cool as a sandalwood tree,

analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained knowledge, clairvoyance, and discerning wisdom.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: He was not concerned with worldly gain, passion, or praise.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: He had become the object of offerings, veneration, and respectful address by Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One,

analyzed: btsun pa / dge slong 'dis las ci bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what action did this monk take

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan par skyes la lus thog thag nas phyi sa'i dri 'byung bar gyur lags /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan par skyes la lus thog thag nas phyi sa'i dri 'byung bar gyur lags /
translated: that it ripened such that he was born with eighteen unattractive features and his body smelled of excrement?

original: las ci bgyis na /
analyzed: las ci bgyis na /
translated: What action did he take

analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu mi sdug pa ma mchis par gyur te bzang por gyur la /
translated: that as soon as he generated the thought of going forth, his unattractive features disappeared and he became handsome?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
translated: He pleased the Blessed One but did not displease him, went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dag slong dag /
analyzed: dag slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: 'di nyid kyis las 'di lta bu byas shing bsags te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis las 'di lta bu byas shing bsags te /
translated: it is this very monk who performed and accumulated the actions that ripened into his having an excellent body, and that ripened into his becoming a monk, casting away all afflictive emotions, and manifesting arhatship.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod kyi grong zhig na bram ze gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig gnas pa de /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod kyi grong zhig na bram ze gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig gnas pa de /
translated: in the past, in a certain mountain village, there lived a brahman who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: byad gzugs dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas dregs nas @291a *//
analyzed: byad gzugs dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas dregs nas @291a *//
translated: He was arrogant because of his handsome appearance and youth,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze du ma la brnyas par byed do //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze du ma la brnyas par byed do //
translated: and he insulted many śramaṇas and brahmins.

original: de nas phyi zhig na de khang thog tu song ste bram ze'i khye'u dag gis bskor cing 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na de khang thog tu song ste bram ze'i khye'u dag gis bskor cing 'dug go /
translated: One day he went up to the roof of his house and sat surrounded by young brahmins.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang sangs rgyas sdug cing phongs pa rnams la snying brtse ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang sangs rgyas sdug cing phongs pa rnams la snying brtse ba /
translated: When the buddhas do not appear in the world, the solitary realizers, who are the world’s sole object of generosity, appear in the world.

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal gyis 'tsho ba'i bse ru lta bu 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ste /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal gyis 'tsho ba'i bse ru lta bu 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ste /
translated: They are solitary realizers who, out of compassion for the poor and destitute, live in remote places and sustain themselves on alms.

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas shig ri khrod kyi grong khyer der bsod snyoms la song nas des bza' ba dang bca' ba bzang po dag rnyed de /

original: de khyer zhing bram ze de'i khyim gyi sgo drung nas lam po che'i logs su chas pa dang / de bram ze des mthong nas bram ze de'i mdun na'ang gyo mo phyi sas gang ba zhig 'dug ste /
analyzed: de khyer zhing bram ze de'i khyim gyi sgo drung nas lam po che'i logs su chas pa dang / de bram ze des mthong nas bram ze de'i mdun na'ang gyo mo phyi sas gang ba zhig 'dug ste /

translated: Then the Blessed One thought, “The time has come to tame those five hundred sages.” He disappeared from Śrāvastī and went to that forest. The five hundred sages saw the Blessed Buddha from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang gcig la gcig smras pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang gcig la gcig smras pa /
translated: When they saw him, they said to each other,

analyzed: mang du len cing 'tsho ba spong ba btang ba de 'dir 'ongs kyi /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdul bar bya ba'i dbang gis de dag gi @297b thad du gshegs te thams cad la bka' stsal na /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in accordance with the power of those to be trained, went to them and spoke to them all.

analyzed: de dag gis lag brdas spyil po bstan pa ma gtogs par bcom ldan 'das kyi lan ma gsol to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyil po de'i nang du gshegs te rtsva stan bshams pa la bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drang srong lnga brgya po de dag drang ba'i phyir bkod ma 'khyil ba'i mtshe'u de bskams par byin gyis brlabs so; ;de nas drang srong lnga
translated: Then the Blessed One entered that hut and sat on the prepared grass seat. The Blessed One blessed the drying up of the whirlpool lake in order to guide those five hundred sages.

analyzed: brgya po da dag gis mtshe'u de na chu med par mthong ngo //

analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi mtshe'u der chu ma byung ngo //

analyzed: de nas de dag dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir lhas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag la rang gi lus bstan nas smras pa /
translated: Then, in order to generate faith in them, the god revealed his body to the five hundred sages and said,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

analyzed: khyed bdag cag bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs te ci bya /
translated: what should we do when we are tormented by hunger and thirst?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: “The Blessed One

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin gyi /
translated: is one of great miracles and great power.

translated: Go for refuge to the Blessed One himself, and by the power of the Blessed One, this pond of water will return to its former state.”

original: de nas drang srong lnga brgya po de rnams kyis lhas bsgo ba thos nas bcom ldan 'das sla shin tu dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: de nas drang srong lnga brgya po de rnams kyis lhas bsgo ba thos nas bcom ldan 'das sla shin tu dga' ba skyes so //
translated: Then, having heard the god’s instruction, the five hundred sages were overjoyed.

translated: Having been overjoyed, they went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, they asked for forgiveness and sat in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam @298a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam @298a *//
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts of those bodhisattvas,🔽

analyzed: pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing their thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, taught them the Dharma accordingly.

original: de nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis stan de nyid la 'dug cing 'khod bzhin du bden pa rtogs pa'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /

translated: Then, while seated right there, those five hundred sages directly experienced the fruit of nonreturn.

translated: Having seen the truths, they rose from their seats, drew down the right shoulder of their upper garments, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:

analyzed: bdag cag bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: We wish to practice pure conduct in the presence of the Blessed One.”

translated: Then the Blessed One, with the words “Come, join me, monks!” ordained the five hundred sages, conferred full ordination on them, and gave them instruction.

original: de rnams kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: They, in turn, through diligence, practice, and effort, abandoned all disturbing emotions and actualized arhatship.

analyzed: de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: As arhats, free from attachment to the three realms, they became equal to the earth with respect to gold and clods of dirt.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: Their minds became like the sky and the palm of the hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /

original: rig pas sgo @298b nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo @298b nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: They broke open the eggshell of ignorance with the vajra of wisdom.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: They attained knowledge, superknowledge, and discriminative understanding.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: He did not look at the gains, desires, and honors of the world.

analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: He became an object of worship, reverence, and respectful address by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de dag rab tu phyung bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas nags khrod de nas mi snang bar gyur te rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One, having ordained and fully ordained them, disappeared from that forest and went to the Jeta Grove.

original: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de rnams nags khrod de nyid na 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de rnams nags khrod de nyid na 'khod do //
translated: Then those five hundred monks stayed right there in that forest.

analyzed: zhes bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis thos so //
translated: The faithful brahmins and householders heard this.

translated: Having heard it, they built a monastery in that forest, complete in every respect, and offered it to the Buddha and the community of monks.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed Buddha,

analyzed: btsun pa / dge slong lnga brgya po 'di rnams kyis las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what karma did these five hundred monks create

original: des de'i rnam par smin pas 'di rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
analyzed: des de'i rnam par smin pas 'di rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
translated: that it has ripened such that they pleased the Blessed One, did not displease him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship?”

original: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
translated: “Monks, the power of their aspirations is what caused it.”

original: btsun pa / 'di rnams kyis smon lam gang du btab lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / 'di rnams kyis smon lam gang du btab lags /
translated: “Lord, what aspirations did they make?”

original: dge slong dag /🔽sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus @299a *//
analyzed: dge slong dag / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus @299a *//
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye rgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: in times past, in this fortunate eon, when people lived as long as twenty thousand years and the tathāgata, the arhat, the totally and completely awakened buddha possessed of insight and perfect conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the tamer of persons, the charioteer, the unsurpassed one, the teacher of humans and gods, the blessed buddha known as Kāśyapa was in the world,

original: bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /🔽lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa / lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: He was the Sugata, the Knower of the World,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: the Unsurpassed Trainer of Trainees, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the World-Honored One, the Buddha called Kasyapa.
