original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te de thos nas khyim bdag gis bu des stan de kho na la 'dug bzhin du 'jig @302a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te de thos nas khyim bdag gis bu des stan de kho na la 'dug bzhin du 'jig @302a *//
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the householder’s son, taught the Dharma accordingly. Having heard it, the householder’s son, while sitting right there, destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and directly experienced the fruit of stream entry.

original: tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /🔽des bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te / des bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: He then destroyed the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the perishable constituents with the diamond of knowledge and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where he sat.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen the truths, he rose from his seat, drew down the right shoulder of his upper garment, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:

original: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if permitted I wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete my novitiate, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: May I too, under the Blessed One, practice pure conduct.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gzhon nu / khyod kyis pha ma la byas sam /
analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod kyis pha ma la byas sam /
translated: “Young man, have you asked your parents?”

original: btsun pa / ma bgyis lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa / ma bgyis lags so //
translated: “No, I have not, Lord.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gzhon nu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gzhon nu /
translated: “Young man,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams ni pha mas ma gnang bar rab tu 'byin par mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams ni pha mas ma gnang bar rab tu 'byin par mi mdzad kyi /
translated: The Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddha do not allow going forth without the permission of one’s parents.🔽Ask your parents and return.

original: pha ma la gsol te phyir shog cig dang / de'i 'og tu khyod kyi sla bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha ma la gsol te phyir shog cig dang / de'i 'og tu khyod kyi sla bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it will be easy for you.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin du 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo //
translated: “I will do just that.”

original: zhes gsol nas khyim bdag gi bu de pha ma'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: zhes gsol nas khyim bdag gi bu de pha ma'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: Having said that, the householder’s son went to his parents and said,

original: yab yum / bdag bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: yab yum / bdag bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar gnang bar mdzad du gsol zhes byas so //
translated: “Father, Mother, please give me permission to go forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One.”

original: de nas pha ma gnyis kyis bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas pha ma gnyis kyis bsam pa /
translated: Then the two parents thought,🔽“We cannot stop him.”

original: bdag cag gis 'di bzlog @302b mi nus so snyam nas smras pa /
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di bzlog @302b mi nus so snyam nas smras pa /
translated: So they said,

original: bu / gnang gi /
analyzed: bu / gnang gi /
translated: “Son, we give you permission.

original: khyod kyis gang gi tshe cung zad khyad par 'ga' zhig thob par gyur pa de'i tshe bdag cag la bltar shog cig ces byas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis gang gi tshe cung zad khyad par 'ga' zhig thob par gyur pa de'i tshe bdag cag la bltar shog cig ces byas so //
translated: But when you have attained something special, then come to see us.”

original: de nas de ltar bgyi'o; ;zhes smras nas khye'u de bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo
analyzed: de nas de ltar bgyi'o; ;zhes smras nas khye'u de bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo
translated: “I will do as you say.”

original: sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the young man went to the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, drew down the right shoulder of his upper garment, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and requested the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / bdag pha mas gnang ba lags na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag pha mas gnang ba lags na /
translated: “Lord, my parents have given me permission.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: If it pleases you, I would like to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete the monastic training, and achieve the state of a monk.

original: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: I would like to practice pure conduct in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
translated: Then the Blessed One led the young householder to go forth with the words “Come, join me, monk,” and he fully ordained him. He then gave him instruction,

original: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /🔽de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te / de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: He then abandoned all afflictive emotions through diligence, practice, and effort, and manifested arhatship.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He became an arhat, free from the attachments of the three realms, with a mind like space or the palm of his hand,

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: cool like sandalwood,

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /🔽rig pa dang mngon @303a *//
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa / rig pa dang mngon @303a *//
translated: his insight breaking open the shell,

original: par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: his knowledge, clairvoyance, and discriminating awareness all attained.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: He was no longer concerned with worldly profit, passion, or praise,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchad cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchad cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: and he became an object of offering, veneration, and respectful address for Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: des dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas pha ma gnyis bden pa rnams la bkod de /
analyzed: des dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas pha ma gnyis bden pa rnams la bkod de /
translated: After attaining arhatship, he established his parents in the truths.

original: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i bgo bsha' rnams la'ang btsud nas khyim de chu dong lta bur gyur par byas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i bgo bsha' rnams la'ang btsud nas khyim de chu dong lta bur gyur par byas so //
translated: He also introduced them to generosity and the sharing of gifts, turning the house into a wellspring.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / khyim bdag gi bu 'dis las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / khyim bdag gi bu 'dis las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what action did this householder’s son take

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dis mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
translated: that ripened into his birth into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth, that he pleased the Blessed One, did not displease him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis nas 'di ltar 'di nyid la brten te khyim gyi nang mi thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis nas 'di ltar 'di nyid la brten te khyim gyi nang mi thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis te mi mnyes par
translated: went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship, and that he has now brought the entire household to please the Blessed One, not displease him,

original: ma bgyis lags /
analyzed: ma bgyis lags /
translated: and go forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang las gyur to //
translated: “It is due to the power of his aspirations.”

original: btsun pa / 'dis smon lam gang du btab lags /
analyzed: btsun pa / 'dis smon lam gang du btab lags /
translated: “Noble one, what prayers did he make?”

original: dge slong dag /🔽sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa la skye rgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @303b rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /🔽'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa la skye rgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @303b rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa / 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: in the past, ninety-one eons ago, when people’s lifespans were eighty thousand years, the totally and completely awakened Buddha possessed of insight and perfect conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the tamer of persons, the charioteer, the unsurpassed one, the teacher of humans and gods, the blessed buddha known as Vipaśyin appeared in the world.🔽“When he had completed all the activities of a buddha, he passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder, like a fire when the wood is exhausted.

original: de gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad nas shing zad pa'i me bzhin du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas grong khyer gnyen ldan gyi rgyal pos de'i sku gdung gi mchod
analyzed: de gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad nas shing zad pa'i me bzhin du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas grong khyer gnyen ldan gyi rgyal pos de'i sku gdung gi mchod
translated: The king of the city of Bandhumatī made offerings to his relics.

original: rten brtsigs te mchod rten de la srog shing gzugs par bsam nas der skye po phal po che 'dus pa dang / rgyal po des skye bo mang po de dag la bsgo ba /
analyzed: rten brtsigs te mchod rten de la srog shing gzugs par bsam nas der skye po phal po che 'dus pa dang / rgyal po des skye bo mang po de dag la bsgo ba /
translated: He had a stupa built and thought to erect a life-tree in it. A great crowd of people gathered there, and the king said to them:

original: su mchod rten 'di la nor mang du skyed par byed pa des mchod rten 'di la srog shing tshugs shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: su mchod rten 'di la nor mang du skyed par byed pa des mchod rten 'di la srog shing tshugs shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: “Whoever will spend a great deal of money on this stupa, he will erect the life-tree in it.”

original: de nas de'i tshe khyim bdag gi bu zhig sa phyogs der phyin nas khyim bdag gi bu des rgyal po des de skad ces bsgo ba thos so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe khyim bdag gi bu zhig sa phyogs der phyin nas khyim bdag gi bu des rgyal po des de skad ces bsgo ba thos so //
translated: At that time, a son of a householder came to that place, and that son of a householder heard the king say that.

original: thos nas kyang de'i blo skyes pa /
analyzed: thos nas kyang de'i blo skyes pa /
translated: Having heard it, the thought arose in his mind:

original: bdag gis mchod rten de la nor ches mang du bskyed de srog shing gzugs par bya na /
analyzed: bdag gis mchod rten de la nor ches mang du bskyed de srog shing gzugs par bya na /
translated: “I will spend a great deal of money on that stupa and erect the life-tree in it.

original: bdag la de tsam gyi 'byor ba dag ni /
analyzed: bdag la de tsam gyi 'byor ba dag ni /
translated: But I do not have that much wealth.

original: med kyi / ma la bdag gis nye du rnams kyi thad du song la btsal te nor bskyed par bya'o snyam nas khyim bdag gi bu des nye du rnams la gsol ba btab pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /🔽brtan por byos la spro ba chen po skyed cig dang / khyod kyis nor ji tsam du bskyed @304a *//
analyzed: med kyi / ma la bdag gis nye du rnams kyi thad du song la btsal te nor bskyed par bya'o snyam nas khyim bdag gi bu des nye du rnams la gsol ba btab pa dang / de dag gis smras pa / brtan por byos la spro ba chen po skyed cig dang / khyod kyis nor ji tsam du bskyed @304a *//
translated: The householder’s son asked his relatives for help, and they said,🔽“Be patient and generate great enthusiasm, and we will give you as much wealth as you can make.

original: pa de snyed nged kyis khyod la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: pa de snyed nged kyis khyod la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I will give you as many of these as you want.”🔽

original: de nas des thos ma thag tu khye'u de dang / rgyal po des gong nas gong du bskyed de gser bye ba phrag drug cu'i bar du bskyed do //
analyzed: de nas des thos ma thag tu khye'u de dang / rgyal po des gong nas gong du bskyed de gser bye ba phrag drug cu'i bar du bskyed do //
translated: As soon as he heard that, the boy and the king made more and more money until they had made sixty million pieces of gold.

original: de nas rgyal po de gzhi de las mi dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de gzhi de las mi dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Then the king became unhappy about this.

original: bdag gis bdag la gnod pa 'di lta bu 'di ci dang ci bya snyam nas yid mi bde zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: bdag gis bdag la gnod pa 'di lta bu 'di ci dang ci bya snyam nas yid mi bde zhing 'dug go /
translated: “What have I done to bring this harm upon myself?” he thought. He sat there feeling unhappy.

original: de nas blon po rnams kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas blon po rnams kyis gsol pa /
translated: Then the ministers said,

original: lha / brtan por mdzod la spro ba chen por bskyed par gsol /
analyzed: lha / brtan por mdzod la spro ba chen por bskyed par gsol /
translated: “Your Majesty, be patient and generate great enthusiasm.

original: bdag cag gis lha la nor dbul bar 'tshal lo //🔽zhes byas so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis lha la nor dbul bar 'tshal lo // zhes byas so //
translated: We will offer wealth to the gods.”

original: khye'u de la yang gnyen 'dun mang po rnams kyis bkag ste rgyal po 'di'i thugs srung dgos kyi /
analyzed: khye'u de la yang gnyen 'dun mang po rnams kyis bkag ste rgyal po 'di'i thugs srung dgos kyi /
translated: The relatives of the young man also tried to stop him, saying, “You must protect the mind of this king.

original: rgyal po dang ma 'gran cig ces byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po dang ma 'gran cig ces byas so //
translated: Do not compete with him.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu khye'u des btang ngo //🔽de nas rgyal po de gzhi de las dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu khye'u des btang ngo // de nas rgyal po de gzhi de las dga' bar gyur te /
translated: As soon as he heard this, the young man let go.

original: khye'u de la longs spyod kyi tshogs chen po byin nas mchod rten de la srog shing btsugs te ring po ma thogs par rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas so; ;mchod rten de la bdug pa dang phye ma dang spos dang me tog rnams kyis bkur🔽sti byas te /
analyzed: khye'u de la longs spyod kyi tshogs chen po byin nas mchod rten de la srog shing btsugs te ring po ma thogs par rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas so; ;mchod rten de la bdug pa dang phye ma dang spos dang me tog rnams kyis bkur sti byas te /
translated: The king was delighted by this and gave the young man a great amount of wealth. He erected the central pole of the stūpa and before long completed it in all its aspects. He honored the stūpa with incense, powders, perfumes, and flowers.

original: mchod rten de'i dus ston gyi lugs bcas so //
analyzed: mchod rten de'i dus ston gyi lugs bcas so //
translated: He established a tradition of annual festivals for the stūpa.

original: de nas khyim bdag gi bu des bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gi bu des bsam pa /
translated: Then the young man thought,

original: mchod rten de la bdag gis gser bye ba phrag drug cu bsngos pa'i rdzas 'di dag bdag nyid kyis longs spyad mi phod kyi /
analyzed: mchod rten de la bdag gis gser bye ba phrag drug cu bsngos pa'i rdzas 'di dag bdag nyid kyis longs spyad mi phod kyi /
translated: I cannot bear to use the materials I have set aside for the stūpa.

original: bdag gis mchod rten 'di nyid la thams cad dbul bar bya'o snyam nas @304b khye'u de nye du dang bcas pas mchod rten de la bkur sti chen po byas nas smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: bdag gis mchod rten 'di nyid la thams cad dbul bar bya'o snyam nas @304b khye'u de nye du dang bcas pas mchod rten de la bkur sti chen po byas nas smon lam btab pa /
translated: I will offer them all to the stūpa.” The boy and his relatives made a great show of respect to the stūpa and made this aspiration:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag gang dang gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig /
translated: “By this root of virtue, wherever I am born, may it be into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth.

original: gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes par shog cig /🔽ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes par shog cig / ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: May I have a beautiful body, be pleasing and attractive to look at.

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: May I please and not displease a teacher just like this one.

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par shog cig ces byas so //
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par shog cig ces byas so //
translated: May I go forth in his doctrine alone, abandon all disturbing emotions, and actualize arhatship.’

original: de nas nye du mang po rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas nye du mang po rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: “Then his many relatives said to him, ‘

original: bu / khyod kyis smon lam ji skad btab /
analyzed: bu / khyod kyis smon lam ji skad btab /
translated: Son, what kind of aspirations have you made?’

original: de nas khye'u des de rnams la thams cad bsnyad nas thos ma thag tu de rnams kyis kyang smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: de nas khye'u des de rnams la thams cad bsnyad nas thos ma thag tu de rnams kyis kyang smon lam btab ste /
translated: “The young man told them everything, and as soon as they heard it, they too made aspirations, saying,

original: bdag cag gis kyang khyod kho na la brten te ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang khyod kho na la brten te ston pa 'di lta bu mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: ‘May we too, relying on you alone, please such a teacher

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: and not displease him.’

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe khyim bdag gi bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyim bdag gi bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one who was that young man then

original: 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid yin te /
translated: is none other than this young man.

original: des der mchod rten la bkur sti byas nas smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes nas gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes par gyur
analyzed: des der mchod rten la bkur sti byas nas smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes nas gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes par gyur
translated: He made offerings to the stūpa and made an aspiration. The act of making offerings to the stūpa and making an aspiration ripened such that wherever he was born, it was into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth, and he was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: te / dge slong dag /🔽nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs dang @305a *//
analyzed: te / dge slong dag / nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs dang @305a *//
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa brnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /
analyzed: shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa brnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /
translated: I attained the very same sameness of essence, the very same sameness of intention, the very same sameness of power, the very same sameness of activity, and the very same sameness of way of being as the Bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Vipaśyin.🔽He pleased me, he did not displease me.

original: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //🔽de'i tshe nye dur gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so // de'i tshe nye dur gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.”🔽“Those who were his relatives then

original: nye du 'di dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: nye du 'di dag nyid yin te /
translated: are none other than these relatives of his now.🔽“Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: de dag gis der smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: de dag gis der smon lam btab ste /
translated: They made this aspiration:🔽“May we too, relying on you alone, please and not displease that Buddha Bhagavat.”

original: bdag cag gis kyang khyod kho na la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de mnyes par byed par gyur cig /🔽mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas pa des na /
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang khyod kho na la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de mnyes par byed par gyur cig / mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces byas pa des na /
translated: Because of that,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: monks,

original: 'di rnams kyis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas so //🔽las brgya tham pa las /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas so // las brgya tham pa las /
translated: they pleased me and did not displease me.🔽This concludes the fourth chapter of the Karmaśataka.

original: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The chapter on the four summary verses:🔽The ugly one, the one who creates happiness, the untouchable,

original: sdom ni / mi sdug bde byed gdol ba dang // rab bzang dang ni lhar bcas glang //
analyzed: sdom ni / mi sdug bde byed gdol ba dang // rab bzang dang ni lhar bcas glang //
translated: Subhadra, the one with gods, the elephant,🔽the compassionate one, the good one, the one with a limp,

original: snying rje bzang po gel po dang // nag po mda' thogs brdzis dang wa //
analyzed: snying rje bzang po gel po dang // nag po mda' thogs brdzis dang wa //
translated: the one with a black arrow, the one who tramples, and the wolf.

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Ugly One

original: bcom ldan 'das yul gar ga zhes bya bar ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul gar ga zhes bya bar ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa las /
translated: The Blessed One, while wandering in the country of Gara,

original: shi shu ma ri'i ri la byon nas shi shu ma ri'i ri 'jigs byed kyi tshal ri dvags kyi nags na bzhugs so //
analyzed: shi shu ma ri'i ri la byon nas shi shu ma ri'i ri 'jigs byed kyi tshal ri dvags kyi nags na bzhugs so //
translated: arrived at Śiśumāra Hill. He stayed in the Śiśumāra Hill Forest of the Fearful, in the Deer Park.

original: de'i tshe shi shu ma ri'i ri la khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe shi shu ma ri'i ri la khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
translated: At that time, there lived on Mount Śiśumāra a householder who was rich and had great wealth and many possessions.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi @305b bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi @305b bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: He had vast and extensive holdings,🔽and he was as wealthy as Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /
translated: He was a rival of Vaiśravaṇa’s wealth.🔽He took a wife from a family of equal rank, and he enjoyed himself with her with love, fun, and pleasure.

original: de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las phyi zhig na; de'i chung ma la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am bcu lon pa dang / khye'u mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan pa zhig btsas nas de mthong ma thag tu pha ma gnyis sdug bsngal chen po dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las phyi zhig na; de'i chung ma la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am bcu lon pa dang / khye'u mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan pa zhig btsas nas de mthong ma thag tu pha ma gnyis sdug bsngal chen po dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: After some time, his wife conceived, and after nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth to a child who was ugly and had eighteen deformities. As soon as his parents saw him, they were overcome with great suffering.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyi bu btsas nas kyang 'di kho na lta bur skyon can du gyur na /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyi bu btsas nas kyang 'di kho na lta bur skyon can du gyur na /
translated: “We have given birth to a child, but he is defective.

original: 'di 'dra ba ci dgos kyi /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ci dgos kyi /
translated: What is the point of having such a child?

original: 'di ni / shi yang sla'i /
analyzed: 'di ni / shi yang sla'i /
translated: It would be better if he died.

original: phyem red nam sros pa dang khyi rnams la sbyin no snyam mo //
analyzed: phyem red nam sros pa dang khyi rnams la sbyin no snyam mo //
translated: At dawn and dusk, I will give it to the dogs.”

original: de nas khyim bdag gi chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag gi chung mas smras pa /
translated: Then the householder’s wife said,

original: mi gsod pa ni /
analyzed: mi gsod pa ni /
translated: “If we kill him,

original: 'jig rten na smad pa'i steng du sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na smad pa'i steng du sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: we will be despised in the world, and we will have committed an action that will lead to rebirth in hell.

original: de ltar mi bgyi bar bu 'di de ltar skyon can du gyur gyis kyang 'di bdag gis dben pa'i phyogs shig tu gsos la gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe khyim nas bskrad de btang ba dang / 'di 'tsho ba ngan ngon tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi bgyi bar bu 'di de ltar skyon can du gyur gyis kyang 'di bdag gis dben pa'i phyogs shig tu gsos la gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe khyim nas bskrad de btang ba dang / 'di 'tsho ba ngan ngon tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: We will not do that. Although this child has such defects, we will raise him in a secluded place. When he has grown up, we will banish him from the house and send him away. Then he will seek a livelihood.”

original: zhes byas nas de gnyis khye'u de dben pa'i phyogs shig tu gsos so //
analyzed: zhes byas nas de gnyis khye'u de dben pa'i phyogs shig tu gsos so //
translated: So the two of them raised the child in a secluded place.

original: de nas de cher skyes pa de dang de'i ming mi sdug pa zhes btags so //
analyzed: de nas de cher skyes pa de dang de'i ming mi sdug pa zhes btags so //
translated: When he had grown up, they gave him the name Durvarṇa.

original: de nas de khyim nas bskrad de btang nas de bkres shing skom pas lus rid par gyur nas 'khar ba dang snod thogs te slong ba la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas de khyim nas bskrad de btang nas de bkres shing skom pas lus rid par gyur nas 'khar ba dang snod thogs te slong ba la zhugs so //
translated: He was then expelled from his home and sent away. He became emaciated from hunger and thirst, and he went out begging with a staff and a bowl.

original: de nas de gang gi khyim sgo'am /
analyzed: de nas de gang gi khyim sgo'am /
translated: Wherever he went, to the door of a house,

original: zong gzhag pa'i @306a *//
analyzed: zong gzhag pa'i @306a *//
translated: to a place where goods were stored,

original: sa'am; tshong khang du 'ongs  pa  der grong mi'i byis pa rnams kyis de la khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyug pa dang bong ba rnams kyis brdegs pa'i dre 'ongs so //
analyzed: sa'am; tshong khang du 'ongs  pa  der grong mi'i byis pa rnams kyis de la khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyug pa dang bong ba rnams kyis brdegs pa'i dre 'ongs so //
translated: or to a shop, the children of the town would come and beat him with their fists, slaps, sticks, and clods of dirt, and they would chase him away, shouting,

original: zhes zer zhing skrod par byed do //
analyzed: zhes zer zhing skrod par byed do //
translated: “Get out, you’re a sinner!”

original: de nas de sdug bsngal chen po skyes te /
analyzed: de nas de sdug bsngal chen po skyes te /
translated: Then, great suffering arose in him.

original: bdag gis las mi dge ba ci zhig byas na /
analyzed: bdag gis las mi dge ba ci zhig byas na /
translated: “What nonvirtuous action did I do

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas bdag gis sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar gyur cig gu /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas bdag gis sdug bsngal 'di lta bu myong bar gyur cig gu /
translated: that I have experienced such suffering as this?”

original: bdag grong khyer na gnas pa btang la grong khyer nas byung ste skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu song la slong mo byas kyang der bdag gis lto gang tsam rnyed grang snyam nas grong nas byung ste skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu rgyu ba
analyzed: bdag grong khyer na gnas pa btang la grong khyer nas byung ste skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu song la slong mo byas kyang der bdag gis lto gang tsam rnyed grang snyam nas grong nas byung ste skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu rgyu ba
translated: “I will leave the city and go to the parks and gardens outside the city to beg for alms.”

original: la zhugs nas der yang de la 'dre yin no snyam nas de dag gis khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyug pa dang bong ba rnams kyis brdegs nas skrod par byed do //
analyzed: la zhugs nas der yang de la 'dre yin no snyam nas de dag gis khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyug pa dang bong ba rnams kyis brdegs nas skrod par byed do //
translated: But when he goes there, they think he is a ghost and drive him away with their fists, slaps, sticks, and clods of dirt.

original: de nas de brdegs pas 'jigs shing skrag la mis 'jigs shing skrag nas tshang tshing dag gi nang du zhugs te nyin mo zad par byed la /
analyzed: de nas de brdegs pas 'jigs shing skrag la mis 'jigs shing skrag nas tshang tshing dag gi nang du zhugs te nyin mo zad par byed la /
translated: Then, frightened and terrified by the beatings, afraid of people, he enters the thickets and spends the day there.

original: nyi ma nub pa'i 'og tu skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu song nas de dag tu kha zas brul ba gang yin pa de dag tsam gyis 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa'i 'og tu skyed mos tshal de dang de dag tu song nas de dag tu kha zas brul ba gang yin pa de dag tsam gyis 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: After sunset, he goes to the parks and gardens and survives on whatever scraps of food he finds there.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i sems can bar ma dor 'chi ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i sems can bar ma dor 'chi ba ni /
translated: Sentient beings in their final existence do not die in the intermediate state.

original: gnas med cing skabs med do //
analyzed: gnas med cing skabs med do //
translated: There is no place and no opportunity for that.

original: des der srog zungs cung zad tsam dag rnyed do //
analyzed: des der srog zungs cung zad tsam dag rnyed do //
translated: They find a little life force there.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the teacher of the one path to be traversed,

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi @306b shes bya dang ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi @306b shes bya dang ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa /
translated: has mastered the two kinds of knowledge of knowable objects and wisdom.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: He is skilled in the three unique foundations of mindfulness.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhes mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhes mi 'jigs pa /
translated: He has the four forms of fearlessness and the four forms of intrepid confidence.🔽He is liberated from the five kinds of rebirth destinies.

original: 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba; skye mched drug la mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba; skye mched drug la mkhas pa /
translated: He is skilled in the six sense bases.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod yul ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod yul ba /
translated: He is engaged in the seven factors of awakening.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa /
translated: He is absorbed in the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: He is absorbed in the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: He possesses the power of the ten powers.

original: yang dag pa'i sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa rnams ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa rnams ni /
translated: He proclaims the great lion’s roar of perfect truth.

original: chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
translated: It is natural for him to do so three times a day.

original: mtshan dus gsum ste nyin mtshan dus drug tu sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /
analyzed: mtshan dus gsum ste nyin mtshan dus drug tu sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /
translated: He looks at the world with the eye of a buddha three times a day and three times a night, that is, six times a day and night.

original: su ni / rgud /🔽su ni / dar /
analyzed: su ni / rgud / su ni / dar /
translated: Who is declining?🔽Who is prospering?

original: su ni / phongs shing 'dug /🔽su ni / nyam nga bar gyur /
analyzed: su ni / phongs shing 'dug / su ni / nyam nga bar gyur /
translated: Who is in trouble?🔽Who is in distress?

original: su ni / gnod pa dang ldan /🔽su ni / phongs pa dang nyam nga ba dang ldan /
analyzed: su ni / gnod pa dang ldan / su ni / phongs pa dang nyam nga ba dang ldan /
translated: Who is in danger?🔽Who is in great danger?🔽Who is in danger and distress?

original: su ni / gnod pa dang ldan /🔽su ni / ngan song du gzhol /
analyzed: su ni / gnod pa dang ldan / su ni / ngan song du gzhol /
translated: Who is in great danger and distress?🔽Who is heading for the lower realms?

original: su ni / ngan song du 'bab /
analyzed: su ni / ngan song du 'bab /
translated: Who is falling into the lower realms?

original: su ni / ngan song du bab /
analyzed: su ni / ngan song du bab /
translated: Who has fallen into the lower realms?

original: su ni / ngas ngan song nas phyung ste mtho ris dang thar ba dang 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
analyzed: su ni / ngas ngan song nas phyung ste mtho ris dang thar ba dang 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
translated: Whom shall I lift from the lower realms and set in the higher realms and in liberation and its result?

original: su ni / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
analyzed: su ni / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
translated: Whom shall I pull out of the mire of bad actions?

original: su ni / 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /
analyzed: su ni / 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /
translated: Whom shall I make a lord of the seven noble riches, when they are without the seven noble riches?

original: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
translated: Whom shall I cause to plant roots of virtue when they have not planted them?

original: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya /🔽su ni / @307a *//
analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya / su ni / @307a *//
translated: Who has already generated the roots of virtue and should be brought to full maturity?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin zin pa las ye shes kyi mtshon gyis brtol bar bya /🔽su la ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin zin pa las ye shes kyi mtshon gyis brtol bar bya / su la ni /
translated: Who has already brought the roots of virtue to full maturity and should be pierced with the spear of wisdom?🔽Who should be brought to the world adorned with the appearance of a buddha and to the result?

original: sangs rgyas byung bas brgyan pa'i 'jig rten 'bras bu dang bcas par bya snyam du ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byung bas brgyan pa'i 'jig rten 'bras bu dang bcas par bya snyam du ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go /
translated: The Bhagavān directs his wisdom vision to these questions.

original: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
translated: The ocean is the abode of sea monsters.

original: dus rlabs yol bar 'gyur yang srid //
analyzed: dus rlabs yol bar 'gyur yang srid //
translated: It is possible that the tide will go out.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i sras rnams la //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i sras rnams la //
translated: But for the sons who are to be tamed,

original: sangs rgyas dus las yol ba med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dus las yol ba med //
translated: the buddhas never miss the time.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u mi sdug pa gdul ba'i dus la bab par dgongs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa las bzhengs nas de kho na gdul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid de bas kyang ches mi sdug pa zhig tu sprul te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u mi sdug pa gdul ba'i dus la bab par dgongs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa las bzhengs nas de kho na gdul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid de bas kyang ches mi sdug pa zhig tu sprul te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, thinking that the time had come to tame the child Aṅgulimāla, arose from the absorption of cessation. In order to tame him, the Buddha emanated a form even more hideous than his.

original: bza' ba dang bcas pas gyo mo bkang nas sa phyogs gang na khye'u mi sdug pa 'dug pa'i sa phyogs der gshegs so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bcas pas gyo mo bkang nas sa phyogs gang na khye'u mi sdug pa 'dug pa'i sa phyogs der gshegs so //
translated: He filled a pot with food and went to the place where the ugly child was.

original: de nas khye'u mi sdug pas thag ring bo zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas khye'u mi sdug pas thag ring bo zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: The ugly child saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang bros te 'di yang 'ongs pa dang bdag la rdeg du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bros te 'di yang 'ongs pa dang bdag la rdeg du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
translated: When he saw him, he ran away, thinking, “He’s coming to beat me again.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas de 'bros mi nus pa de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas de 'bros mi nus pa de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: The Blessed One blessed him so that he could not escape.

original: de'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lta 'dod par gyur te /
analyzed: de'ang bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lta 'dod par gyur te /
translated: And because of the Blessed One’s blessing, he wanted to see him.

original: 'di lta bu su yin pa de re zhig blta'o snyam nas phyir log ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu su yin pa de re zhig blta'o snyam nas phyir log ste /
translated: He thought, “I’ll see who this is,” and he turned around.

original: khye'u mi sdug pas sprul pa mchog tu mi sdug pa de mthong nas mthong ma thag tu de'i blo skyes pa /
analyzed: khye'u mi sdug pas sprul pa mchog tu mi sdug pa de mthong nas mthong ma thag tu de'i blo skyes pa /
translated: When the ugly child saw the emanation, who was extremely ugly, he thought,🔽“

original: 'di kho na 'dra ba khyod su zhig ces @307b dri'o snyam nas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de ga la ba der song ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas khye'u mi sdug pa mthong nas 'bros pa ltar byas pa dang / khye'u mi sdug pa des smras pa /
analyzed: 'di kho na 'dra ba khyod su zhig ces @307b dri'o snyam nas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de ga la ba der song ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas khye'u mi sdug pa mthong nas 'bros pa ltar byas pa dang / khye'u mi sdug pa des smras pa /
translated: Thinking, Who is this who looks like me? he went to where the Buddha's emanation was. When the Buddha's emanation saw the ugly child, he acted as if he were running away. The ugly child said,

original: grogs po; khyod kyis bdag mthong na ci phyir 'bros /
analyzed: grogs po; khyod kyis bdag mthong na ci phyir 'bros /
translated: Friend, why do you run away when you see me?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas smras pa /
translated: The Buddha's emanation said,

original: grogs po / bdag ni /
analyzed: grogs po / bdag ni /
translated: Friend,

original: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas lus 'di lta bur gyur te khyod kyis bdag la 'dre yin no snyam ste brdegs su dogs nas bdag gis khyod mthong nas 'bros so //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas lus 'di lta bur gyur te khyod kyis bdag la 'dre yin no snyam ste brdegs su dogs nas bdag gis khyod mthong nas 'bros so //
translated: because of the ripening of my past karma, I have this kind of body. Fearing that you would think I am a ghost and beat me, I am running away when I see you.

original: khye'u mi sdug pas smras pa /
analyzed: khye'u mi sdug pas smras pa /
translated: The ugly child said,

original: grogs po / bdag kyang sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas 'di ltar mi sdug par gyur te /
analyzed: grogs po / bdag kyang sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas 'di ltar mi sdug par gyur te /
translated: Friend, because of the ripening of my past karma, I have become this ugly.

original: bdag mi sdug pa'i phyir pha mas khyim nas bskrad de bdag slong mo la gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyig pa dang bong ba dag gis brdegs shing bskrad de /
analyzed: bdag mi sdug pa'i phyir pha mas khyim nas bskrad de bdag slong mo la gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der khu tshur dang thal lcag dang dbyig pa dang bong ba dag gis brdegs shing bskrad de /
translated: “Because I am ugly, my parents kicked me out of the house. Wherever I go to beg for alms, I am beaten with fists, slaps, sticks, and clods of earth.

original: bdag mis brdegs pas 'jigs shing skrag nas tshang tshing 'di'i nang du zhugs te 'dug gi /
analyzed: bdag mis brdegs pas 'jigs shing skrag nas tshang tshing 'di'i nang du zhugs te 'dug gi /
translated: Frightened and terrified by people beating me, I entered this thicket and stayed here.🔽Come here, let’s go together and wander around.”

original: khyod kyang tshur shog dang lhan cig 'grogs te rgyu bar bya'o; ;de nas sprul pa des de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyang tshur shog dang lhan cig 'grogs te rgyu bar bya'o; ;de nas sprul pa des de ltar bya'o //
translated: Then the emanation said, “Let’s do it!”

original: zhes smras nas de nyid du 'dug ste des de la kha zas kyi bgo bsha' byas nas de zos te 'grangs shing ngoms la dbang po brtas nas sprul pa de la sems dga' bar gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa'i gzugs mi snang bar mdzad de rang bzhin gyi sku bstan nas khye'u mi sdug pas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu @308a *//
analyzed: zhes smras nas de nyid du 'dug ste des de la kha zas kyi bgo bsha' byas nas de zos te 'grangs shing ngoms la dbang po brtas nas sprul pa de la sems dga' bar gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa'i gzugs mi snang bar mdzad de rang bzhin gyi sku bstan nas khye'u mi sdug pas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu @308a *//
translated: and stayed right there. He shared his food with the ugly man, who ate it, became full and satisfied, and his faculties revived. He felt joy toward the emanation, and the Blessed One made the ugly form disappear and revealed his natural body. The ugly man saw the Blessed One’s body, which was golden in color, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being, and ornamented with the eighty minor marks.

original: chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
analyzed: chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
translated: He was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug sa lta bu /🔽me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug sa lta bu / me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a fire in the shape of a body.🔽He was like a flame anointed with ghee.

original: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
analyzed: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a lamp placed in a golden vessel.

original: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
analyzed: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a jeweled victory banner adorned with various jewels.

original: blo gsal zhing dri ma med par d  dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo gsal zhing dri ma med par d  dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: He was a buddha, a bhagavān, clear-minded and endowed with stainlessness.

original: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /🔽dag ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni; lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu
analyzed: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te / dag ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni; lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu
translated: Having seen him, he was overjoyed.🔽The happiness that a being who has accumulated the roots of virtue experiences when he first sees the Buddha is such that

original: skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: even one who has practiced the mind of śamatha for twelve years does not experience such happiness.

original: de ltar mthong nas lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Having seen him, he was overjoyed with the Bhagavān.

original: de dga' bar gyur nas zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de dga' bar gyur nas zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He was delighted and, bowing his head at the feet of the Blessed One, sat to one side to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: de nas khye'u mi sdug pas stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te des bden pa mthong nas bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas khye'u mi sdug pas stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te des bden pa mthong nas bsam pa /
translated: Then the child Virūpa, while sitting right there, manifested the resultant state of stream entry. Having seen the truths, he thought,

original: gal te bdag gi lus 'di lta bur ma gyur du zin na bdag kyang legs par gsungs pa'i @308b chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung zhing chu bo rnams las brgal bar bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa dang /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi lus 'di lta bur ma gyur du zin na bdag kyang legs par gsungs pa'i @308b chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung zhing chu bo rnams las brgal bar bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa dang /
translated: “If only I had not been born with this kind of body, I too would go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and strive to cross the floodwaters and transcend all bonds.

original: sgrub pa dang / 'bad par bya ba zhig snyam mo; ;de nas rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu khye'u de mi sdug pa med par gyur nas byad gzugs bzang por gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / 'bad par bya ba zhig snyam mo; ;de nas rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu khye'u de mi sdug pa med par gyur nas byad gzugs bzang por gyur te /
translated: As soon as he had this thought of going forth, the young man’s ugliness disappeared and he became well proportioned and handsome.

original: kha dog rgyas pa mchog dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: kha dog rgyas pa mchog dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: He was endowed with the supreme, abundant complexion.

original: de nas de lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' bar gyur nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de lhag par yang bcom ldan 'das la dga' bar gyur nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He then felt even more devotion for the Blessed One. He rose from his seat, drew down the right shoulder of his upper garment, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:

original: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if permitted I wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete my novitiate, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: May I too, in the presence of the Blessed One, practice pure conduct.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
translated: As soon as he said this, the Blessed One fully ordained him, and he also gave him instruction.

original: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad  ngas nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /🔽de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong par mnyam pa /
analyzed: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad  ngas nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te / de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong par mnyam pa /
translated: He then cast off all afflictive emotions through diligence, practice, and effort, and manifested arhatship.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: As an arhat, he became free from desire for the three realms, and his mind became equal regarding gold and filth, the palms of his hands and the soles of his feet, and space and the palm of his hand.

original: @309a *// tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /🔽rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: @309a *// tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa / rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: His mind became cool, like sandalwood.🔽He broke open the eggshell of ignorance with the vajra of knowledge.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: He attained knowledge, clairvoyance, and discerning wisdom, and he no longer cared for worldly profit, desire, or praise.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: He became an object of offering, veneration, and respectful address by Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed Buddha,

original: btsun pa / mi sdug pas las ci bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa / mi sdug pas las ci bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what action did Subhadra take

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes la /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes la /
translated: that ripened into his birth into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth;

original: mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan par gyur nas 'di mi sdug pa'i phyir pha ma gnyis kyis khyim nas bskrad la /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i sna grangs bco brgyad dang ldan par gyur nas 'di mi sdug pa'i phyir pha ma gnyis kyis khyim nas bskrad la /
translated: that he was born with eighteen unattractive features, and that because of his ugliness his parents threw him out of the house;

original: rab tu byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu de'i mi sdug pa ma mchis par gyur te byad gzugs bzang por gyur nas 'dis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis shing mi mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu de'i mi sdug pa ma mchis par gyur te byad gzugs bzang por gyur nas 'dis bcom ldan 'das mnyes par bgyis shing mi mi mnyes par ma bgyis la /
translated: and that as soon as he generated the thought of going forth, his ugliness disappeared and he became handsome, and that he pleased the Blessed One and did not displease him?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis lags /
translated: They went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: mi sdug pa nyid kyi las de lta bu byas shing bsags te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa nyid kyi las de lta bu byas shing bsags te /
translated: they created and accumulated such actions as are ugly,

original: dge slong dag /🔽sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod kyi grong zhig na khyim bdag ser sna can /
analyzed: dge slong dag / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri khrod kyi grong zhig na khyim bdag ser sna can /
translated: “Monks,🔽in the past, in a certain mountain town, there lived a householder who was stingy, greedy, and a tightwad.

original: 'jungs pa / yo byad kun tu 'dzin pa zhig @309b gnas pa las phyi zhig na de khyim na 'dug pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi bzhugs pa'i tshe rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jungs pa / yo byad kun tu 'dzin pa zhig @309b gnas pa las phyi zhig na de khyim na 'dug pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi bzhugs pa'i tshe rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung ste /
translated: One day, when he was at home, a certain solitary buddha came to his house for alms.

original: rang sangs rgyas shig khyim bdag de'i khyim du bsod snyoms la 'ongs nas khyim bdag des de la bsod snyoms phul ba las bsod snyoms phul ba'i 'og tu 'gyod pa skyes te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas shig khyim bdag de'i khyim du bsod snyoms la 'ongs nas khyim bdag des de la bsod snyoms phul ba las bsod snyoms phul ba'i 'og tu 'gyod pa skyes te /
translated: The householder gave him alms, but after he had given the alms, he felt regret.

original: bdag gis zas 'di dge sbyong mgo reg /
analyzed: bdag gis zas 'di dge sbyong mgo reg /
translated: “I would rather give this food to a śramaṇa with matted hair

original: las med pa 'di la byin pa bas ni /
analyzed: las med pa 'di la byin pa bas ni /
translated: than to this one who is not working.

original: tshal za'am / las byed pa la byin dang rung bzhig snyam ste /
analyzed: tshal za'am / las byed pa la byin dang rung bzhig snyam ste /
translated: It would be better to give it to someone who eats in the forest or who works.”

original: de 'gyod par gyur pas kha zas de phyir 'phrog nas lus dang ngag gi las tshul mi sdug pas mtho brtsams te khyim nas bskrad do //
analyzed: de 'gyod par gyur pas kha zas de phyir 'phrog nas lus dang ngag gi las tshul mi sdug pas mtho brtsams te khyim nas bskrad do //
translated: Because of his regret, he took back the food and, with his body and speech acting in an unpleasant way, he threw him out of the house.

original: de nas rang sangs rgyas des bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas rang sangs rgyas des bsam pa /
translated: Then the solitary buddha thought,

original: nyon mongs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di ni /
translated: “This man is

original: dmas shing nyams par gyur te /
analyzed: dmas shing nyams par gyur te /
translated: degraded and ruined.

original: gtan du dams par gyur na mi rung gi /
analyzed: gtan du dams par gyur na mi rung gi /
translated: It would not be right to let him be ruined forever.🔽I must help him.”🔽He rose up into the sky and displayed the miracles of blazing with fire,

original: 'di'i ra mda' bya dgos so snyam nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags te 'bar ba dang / lam mer 'dug pa dang / char pa 'bab pa dang / glog 'gyu ba'i cho 'phrul rnams bstan to //🔽so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di'i ra mda' bya dgos so snyam nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags te 'bar ba dang / lam mer 'dug pa dang / char pa 'bab pa dang / glog 'gyu ba'i cho 'phrul rnams bstan to // so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
translated: shining with light, raining, and flashing with lightning.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis myur du dad par byed de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis myur du dad par byed de /
translated: Ordinary people are quickly made to have faith by miracles.

original: de shing ljon pa sog les bcad pa bzhin du zhabs la phyag btsal nas smras pa /
analyzed: de shing ljon pa sog les bcad pa bzhin du zhabs la phyag btsal nas smras pa /
translated: He prostrated at the feet of the solitary buddha like a tree cut down by a saw and said,🔽“Noble one, please come down.”

original: skal ba chen po dang ldan pa mar gshegs /
analyzed: skal ba chen po dang ldan pa mar gshegs /
translated: “You are very fortunate. Come down!”

original: bdag nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba'i lag nas drang du gsol zhes bas so //
analyzed: bdag nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba'i lag nas drang du gsol zhes bas so //
translated: “Please pull me out of the mud of my bad behavior.”

original: rang sangs rgyas de'ang de kho na la snying brtse ba'i phyir sa la babs nas des rkang pa la phyag btsal te @310a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de'ang de kho na la snying brtse ba'i phyir sa la babs nas des rkang pa la phyag btsal te @310a *//
translated: The solitary buddha, out of love for him, descended to the ground. He bowed down at the feet of the solitary buddha,

original: bzod pa gsol nas yang bsod snyoms phul te smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: bzod pa gsol nas yang bsod snyoms phul te smon lam btab pa /
translated: asked for forgiveness, and again offered alms. He made this aspiration:

original: 'di ltar bdag gis yon gnas 'di lta bu la gnod pa byas pa'i las 'di'i skal ba can du bdag ma gyur cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis yon gnas 'di lta bu la gnod pa byas pa'i las 'di'i skal ba can du bdag ma gyur cig /
translated: “By this karma of mine, which is to harm such a worthy recipient, may I not come to have a share of it.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis phyir yang bkur sti byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig /🔽'di bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par gyur cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis phyir yang bkur sti byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skye bar shog cig / 'di bas kyang ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par gyur cig /
translated: By this root of virtue of my again showing respect, wherever I am born, may it be into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth.

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: May I please and not displease a teacher even more exalted than this.

original: yon tan 'di lta bu dag kyang thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: yon tan 'di lta bu dag kyang thob par gyur cig /
translated: May I obtain such qualities!

original: gal te sdig pa'i las 'di'i 'bras bu gdon mi za bar bdag la smin par gyur na yang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu bdag gi mi sdug pa med par gyur te byad gzugs bzang por gyur cig ces byas so //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: gal te sdig pa'i las 'di'i 'bras bu gdon mi za bar bdag la smin par gyur na yang rab tu 'byung ba'i sems bskyed ma thag tu bdag gi mi sdug pa med par gyur te byad gzugs bzang por gyur cig ces byas so // dge slong dag /
translated: If the result of this evil action is certain to ripen upon me, then as soon as I give rise to the thought of going forth, may my ugliness disappear and may I become well proportioned and beautiful.’

original: ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: des der rang sangs rgyas la bsod snyoms phul ba'i 'og tu phyir 'phrog ste lus dang ngag gi las tshul mi sdug pas mtho brtsams nas khyim nas bskrad pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ni; gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der mi sdug par gyur
translated: Because he stole back the alms that he had offered to the solitary buddha, and because he acted in an ugly manner with his body and speech, and because he expelled him from the house, as the result of that karma, wherever he was born, he was ugly,

analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes par de dang der phyug cing nor mngal longs spyod che ba'i rigs su skyes te /

analyzed: nga rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum bas kyang ches lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa nga lta bu 'dis mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /

translated: May I please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next blessed buddha.

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon @311a *//
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon @311a *//
translated: May I go forth in his doctrine alone,

analyzed: mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas pa des na /

analyzed: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung dang shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa mnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /

original: las brgya tham pa /
analyzed: las brgya tham pa /
translated: The Hundred Karma-s

original: bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: Book Eighteen

translated: The One Who Brings Happiness🔽The Story of the One Who Brings Happiness🔽The Story of King Prasenajit🔽The Story of the One Who Brings Happiness

analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na rgyal po gsal rgyal rgyal po byed do //
translated: The Story of King Prasenajit

analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun par gyur nas dus dus su skye bo mang po kha 'dog par byed do //
translated: Those two were mutually hostile and from time to time they slaughtered many people.🔽Then, on one occasion, King Brahmadatta,

translated: the elephant division, the cavalry, the chariot division, and the infantry—in order to fight, led them to King Prasenajit and set up camp on the banks of the river Aciravatī.

translated: Then King Prasenajit, having heard that the king of Kāśi, Brahmadatta, had equipped the four divisions of his army and led them to fight against him,

translated: Then, while they were still there, the queen of King Brahmadatta became pregnant. After nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth to a child who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

analyzed: de btsas ma thag tu pho brang 'khor der kun dga' ba'i rol mo'i sgra bsgrags so //

analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rgyal po tshangs pas byin gyi bu mo gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas so //

original: zhes thos nas thos ma thag tu dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: zhes thos nas thos ma thag tu dga' bar gyur te /

analyzed: tshangs pas byin dang gnyen du bya ba'i thabs bdag gis rnyed do //

translated: King Prasenajit sent a messenger to King Brahmadatta with the message,

original: grogs po / 'khon med par bya'o //
analyzed: grogs po / 'khon med par bya'o //

analyzed: bu mo 'di la brten te bdag cag @312a *// 'khon med par bya yi / bu mo 'o ni /
translated: Let us use this girl to end our feud.

analyzed: bdag gi chung mar byin cig ces byas so //
translated: Give me your daughter and I will make her my chief wife.”🔽As soon as King Brahmadatta heard this, he was delighted and thought,

analyzed: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin gyis da thos ma thag tu dga' bar gyur te bsam pa /

analyzed: 'di dang bdag gis dus dus su skye bo mang po kha 'dog par byed kyi /
translated: “I and he have killed many people at different times.🔽I will make peace with him by giving him my daughter.”

analyzed: bu mo de la brten te 'di dang 'khon med par bya'o snyam bsam nas des kyang de la pho nya'i lan btang ste /
translated: He sent a messenger to him with this message:

analyzed: khyod ji ltar dga' ba de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: “I will do whatever you want.”

analyzed: zhes byas nas mjal du ma byas te mgul nas 'khyud nas bu mo sbyin par byas te rang gi yul du song ngo //
translated: He did not meet with him, but gave him his daughter in marriage by embracing her around the neck. He then went to his own country.

analyzed: de rang gi yul du song ba dang / bu mo 'di'i btsas ston byas nas bu mo 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: When he arrived in his own country, he celebrated the birth of his daughter and gave her a name, saying,

analyzed: bu mo 'di btsas pa na yul khams gnyis bde bar gyur pas na bu mo 'di'i ming bde byed ma zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //
translated: “Since this girl was born and both countries are happy, let us name this girl Kṣemā (Safety).”

original: de nas bu mo bde byed ma 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khus bskyed bsrings so //
analyzed: de nas bu mo bde byed ma 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khus bskyed bsrings so //
translated: Then the girl Kṣemā was nourished with milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni /

analyzed: tshva chu dang mtshungs te ji tsam du brten pa de tsam du rab tu 'phel bar gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na yang rgyal po tshangs pas byin gyi btsun mo la bu chags par gyur nas de zla ba dgu'am bcu lon pa dang bu khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug pa mdzes pa zhig btsas te de'i btsas ston yang rgyas par byas nas khye'u
translated: Later, King Brahmadatta’s queen conceived a child, and after nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth to a child who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.🔽They prepared an elaborate feast for the birth and celebrated widely.

analyzed: 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs @312b bar byed de /
translated: “What name should we give this child?”

analyzed: khye'u 'di sring mo bde byed ma'i 'og tu btsas pas na /
translated: “Since this child was born after his sister, Kṣemā,

analyzed: khye'u 'di'i ming bde byed ces gdags so zhes zer ro //
translated: let us name this child Kṣemaṅkara.”

analyzed: de nas de gnyis gang gi tshe cher skyes pa'i tshe bu mo bde byed ma dang / khye'u bde byed gnyis shin tu mdza' bar gyur te skad cig tsam yang gcig med par 'dug mi phod do //
translated: When they grew up, the girl Kṣemā and the boy Kṣemendra became very fond of each other and could not bear to be apart for a moment.

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rgyal po tshangs pas byin la po nya btang ste / bu mo bu la blang ngo //
translated: One day King Prasenajit sent a messenger to King Brahmadatta:

original: zhes spring ngo //
analyzed: zhes spring ngo //

analyzed: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas phyin gyis kyang thos ma thag tu rgyal po gsal rgyal la pho nya'i lan btang ste 'di la thogs pa ci'ang med kyi /

original: che ge mo zhig gi nyin par shog cig ces byas so //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig gi nyin par shog cig ces byas so //

translated: Then, with great wealth and the great power of the king, he went to the land of Kāśi and, having acted in accordance with the householder’s duties of a householder, King Brahmadatta gave his daughter in marriage.

original: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi bu mo khyer te rang gi yul du chas so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi bu mo khyer te rang gi yul du chas so //
translated: Then King Prasenajit took the girl and set out for his own country.

original: de nas khye'u bde byed kyis pha ma la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas khye'u bde byed kyis pha ma la smras pa /
translated: Then the boy Kṣemaṅkara said to his parents,

analyzed: che zhe bde byed ma mchis par bdag mchis mi phod kyi /

original: bdag kyang 'di dang lhan cig mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang 'di dang lhan cig mchi'o //

original: zhes byas nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin gyis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: zhes byas nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin gyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then King Brahmadatta said this:

original: bu / khyod @313a *//
analyzed: bu / khyod @313a *//
translated: “Son,

analyzed: ni; nga'i bu gcig bu sdug cing phangs pa rgyal tshab yin te /

analyzed: nga 'das pa'i 'og tu rgyal po bya dgos so //
translated: After I have passed away, you will be the king.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
