analyzed: des lcags kyi ta la bdun dang / 'khor lo bdun dang / @333a *//
translated: It went through the seven iron palm trees, the seven wheels,🔽the seven iron oxen, the seven copper oxen, the seven silver oxen, the seven golden oxen, the seven men, and entered the earth.

original: rnga bo che bdun dang / phag bdun las thal nas mda' de sa'i 'og tu song ngo //
analyzed: rnga bo che bdun dang / phag bdun las thal nas mda' de sa'i 'og tu song ngo //
translated: The arrow passed through the seven drums and seven pigs and went into the ground.

original: de nas de mthong ma thag tu gzhon nu de dag gi stobs kyis rgyags par gyur pa gang yin pa de'ang med par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de mthong ma thag tu gzhon nu de dag gi stobs kyis rgyags par gyur pa gang yin pa de'ang med par gyur te /
translated: As soon as they saw that, the pride of their strength was gone.

original: bcom ldan 'das la yang dga' bar gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag yid dga' bar gyur par thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la yang dga' bar gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag yid dga' bar gyur par thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: They were delighted with the Blessed One, and the Blessed One, knowing their minds were ready, taught them the Dharma that was appropriate for them.

original: de nas gzhon nu lnga brgya po de dag gis stan de kho na la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu lnga brgya po de dag gis stan de kho na la 'khod bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
translated: Then, right where they sat, the five hundred young men destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen the truths, they rose from their seats, drew down the right shoulder of their upper garments, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:

original: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if permitted we wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete our novitiates, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: We too wish to practice the holy life in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: de nas de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de dag la lung yang phog go /
analyzed: de nas de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de dag la lung yang phog go /
translated: Then the Blessed One led them to go forth as novices, conferred on them full ordination, and instructed them.

original: de dag gis kyang brtson @333b pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang brtson @333b pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: They too, through diligence, practice, and effort, abandoned all defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

original: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: They became arhats, free from desire for the three realms, with minds equal to the wind,

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra b'a sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra b'a sems dang ldan pa /
translated: with minds like space or the palm of the hand,

original: tsandan sbangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan sbangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: with minds cooled like sandalwood,

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: with minds that had shattered the shell of ignorance,

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: with minds that had attained knowledge, higher knowledge, and discriminative knowledge,

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: with minds that did not look to the acquisitions, attachments, and honors of the world,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: with minds that had become objects of worship, veneration, and respectful address by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the monks requested the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, please tell us why the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Completely Perfect Buddha, the one with perfect knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the charioteer who tames beings, the unsurpassed one, the teacher of gods and humans, the Blessed Buddha, has a body that is golden colored, with a halo extending an arm’s length, and a head adorned with a topknot and ushṇīṣa.

original: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhon nu lnga brgya po rnams lhar bcas la brten te nga rgyal bcag nas g-yung drung gi mthar phyin pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhag pa gzigs /
analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhon nu lnga brgya po rnams lhar bcas la brten te nga rgyal bcag nas g-yung drung gi mthar phyin pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhag pa gzigs /
translated: “Lord, you saw that five hundred youths, having been brought down from their pride by the gods, were established in the unsurpassed, supreme welfare of nirvāṇa, and in the peace of the deathless.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: “Not only now,

original: 'das pa'i dus na'ang 'di rnams lhar bcas la brten te dregs pa bcom nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa de nyon cig /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na'ang 'di rnams lhar bcas la brten te dregs pa bcom nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa de nyon cig /
translated: but in the past as well, and also in the future, I will bring them down from their pride by means of the gods and establish them in the four meditative states and the five superknowledges.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong khyer tsam pa zhes bya ba na rgyal po gang chen mtsho'i lha zhes @334a *//🔽bya ba rgyal po byed de /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong khyer tsam pa zhes bya ba na rgyal po gang chen mtsho'i lha zhes @334a *// bya ba rgyal po byed de /
translated: in the past, in the city of Campa, a king named Maṇisāgara ruled.

original: phyi zhig na de'i btsun mo la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am zla ba bcu lon pa dang bu gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: phyi zhig na de'i btsun mo la bu chags nas de zla ba dgu'am zla ba bcu lon pa dang bu gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: One day his queen conceived a child, and after nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth to a child who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: tshan po che'i stobs dang ldan pa zhig btsas te /
analyzed: tshan po che'i stobs dang ldan pa zhig btsas te /
translated: He was powerful like a great nāga.

original: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas khye'u 'di'i ming ji skad gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: When he was born, they held a great celebration and gave him a name.

original: khye'u 'di gang chen mtsho'i lha'i bu yin pas na /🔽khye'u 'di'i ming rgya mtsho'i lha zhes gdags so //
analyzed: khye'u 'di gang chen mtsho'i lha'i bu yin pas na / khye'u 'di'i ming rgya mtsho'i lha zhes gdags so //
translated: “Since this child is the son of the ocean god,

original: zhes zer to //
analyzed: zhes zer to //
translated: let us name this child Sāgaradeva.”

original: de nas khye'u rgya mtsho'i lha'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khu rnams kyis bskyed bsrings te /
analyzed: de nas khye'u rgya mtsho'i lha'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khu rnams kyis bskyed bsrings te /
translated: The child Sāgaradeva was raised on milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids.

original: de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe khye'u de yi ge slob tu bcug ste rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po rnams kyi bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas tha dad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe khye'u de yi ge slob tu bcug ste rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po rnams kyi bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas tha dad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: When he grew up, he was taught letters and the various crafts and occupations of the royal class, such as

analyzed: glang po che zhon pa dang / rta zhon pa dang / mtshon cha 'chang ba dang / 'phong dang / mdun du bsnur ba dang / phyir bsnur ba dang / g-yul las 'byung bar bya ba dang / zhags pa gzung ba dang / mda' bo che 'phang ba dang /
translated: He trained in riding elephants, riding horses, wielding weapons, archery, advancing, retreating, engaging in battle, using lassos, throwing spears,

original: rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'phang ba dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa gdab pa dang / 'khor lo 'phang ba dang / gcad pa dang / gsheg pa dang / lag pas gzang ba dang / rkang pa'i stabs dang / mgo bo bskyab pa dang / rkyang mang 'phang ba dang /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'phang ba dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa gdab pa dang / 'khor lo 'phang ba dang / gcad pa dang / gsheg pa dang / lag pas gzang ba dang / rkang pa'i stabs dang / mgo bo bskyab pa dang / rkyang mang 'phang ba dang /
translated: throwing single-pointed vajras, throwing single-pointed weapons, throwing discuses, cutting, stabbing, catching with the hands, footwork, protecting the head, throwing side-kicks,

original: sgra grag par 'phang ba dang / gnad du 'phang ba dang / gdon mi za bar phog par @334b bya ba dang / tshabs cher gtang ba rnams kyang bslabs nas gnas lnga la byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: sgra grag par 'phang ba dang / gnad du 'phang ba dang / gdon mi za bar phog par @334b bya ba dang / tshabs cher gtang ba rnams kyang bslabs nas gnas lnga la byang bar gyur to //
translated: throwing with a loud noise, throwing to the vital points, hitting without fail, and causing great harm. He became skilled in all five fields.

original: de nas des bltas na /
analyzed: de nas des bltas na /
translated: Then he looked around🔽and saw that the people of the city were all gathered in the park. He went to the park and saw that the people were all gathered around the sage.

original: pha chos bzhin dang chos ma yin par rgyal srid byed pa mthong na de'i blo skyes pa; pha 'das pa'i 'og tu bdag gis rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang bya dgos par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: pha chos bzhin dang chos ma yin par rgyal srid byed pa mthong na de'i blo skyes pa; pha 'das pa'i 'og tu bdag gis rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang bya dgos par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “After my father passes away, I will have to rule the kingdom.🔽I will give up living in the home and go to live in the forest.”

original: bdag gis khyim na gnas pa btang la nags kyi nang du gnas bca' bar bya'o snyam du bsam nas yab la gsol te nags kyi nang du gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bdag gis khyim na gnas pa btang la nags kyi nang du gnas bca' bar bya'o snyam du bsam nas yab la gsol te nags kyi nang du gnas bcas so //
translated: Having thought this, he asked his father’s permission and went to live in the forest.

original: des der song nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
analyzed: des der song nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
translated: When he had gone there, he generated the four meditative states and the five superknowledges.

original: de rab tu byung ba dang rgyal po'i blon po lnga brgyas bu btsas nas de dag gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe de dag yi ge slob tu bcug ste gnas lnga'i bar du byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de rab tu byung ba dang rgyal po'i blon po lnga brgyas bu btsas nas de dag gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe de dag yi ge slob tu bcug ste gnas lnga'i bar du byang bar gyur to //
translated: When he had gone forth, five hundred of the king’s ministers had sons. When they grew up, they were made to study letters and became skilled in the five fields of knowledge.

original: de dag blo 'di lta bu skyes te /
analyzed: de dag blo 'di lta bu skyes te /
translated: They thought,

original: gzhan su'ang byad gzugs dang stobs dang shes pas bdag cag dang mnyam pa'ang med na /
analyzed: gzhan su'ang byad gzugs dang stobs dang shes pas bdag cag dang mnyam pa'ang med na /
translated: “No one else is our equal in appearance, strength, or knowledge.

original: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam mo //
analyzed: lhag pa lta ci smos snyam mo //
translated: What need is there to speak of the rest?”

original: de nas 'phong gi slob dpon gyis de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas 'phong gi slob dpon gyis de dag la smras pa /
translated: Then the master of archery said to them,

original: bu dag / de skad ma zer cig khyod ni /🔽rgyal po 'di nyid kyi bu rab nags kyi nang du gnas bcas pa de'i byad gzugs dang stobs dang shes pa'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
analyzed: bu dag / de skad ma zer cig khyod ni / rgyal po 'di nyid kyi bu rab nags kyi nang du gnas bcas pa de'i byad gzugs dang stobs dang shes pa'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
translated: “Sons, do not speak like that.

original: stong gi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: stong gi char yang mi phod do //
translated: You are not even a hundredth or a thousandth the equal of the prince who has gone to live in the forest in terms of his appearance, strength, and knowledge.”🔽When they heard this, the princes wanted to see the sage.

original: zhes byas nas de thos ma thag tu gzhon nu de dag drang srong de lta 'dod par gyur te 'phong gi slob dpon de nyid dang lhan cig tu drang srong de ga la ba der dong nas gzhon nu lnga brgya po de dag gis @335a *//
analyzed: zhes byas nas de thos ma thag tu gzhon nu de dag drang srong de lta 'dod par gyur te 'phong gi slob dpon de nyid dang lhan cig tu drang srong de ga la ba der dong nas gzhon nu lnga brgya po de dag gis @335a *//
translated: Together with the master of archery, they went to where the sage was.

original: thag ring po zhig nas drang srong mdzes shing yid du 'thad la dbang po zhi zhing yid zhi ba de mthong ngo //
analyzed: thag ring po zhig nas drang srong mdzes shing yid du 'thad la dbang po zhi zhing yid zhi ba de mthong ngo //
translated: From a distance, the five hundred princes saw the sage, who was beautiful, pleasing, with his senses and mind at peace.

original: mthong nas de dag gi gzugs kyi rgyags pa gang yin pa de med par gyur te de dag gis bsam pa /
analyzed: mthong nas de dag gi gzugs kyi rgyags pa gang yin pa de med par gyur te de dag gis bsam pa /
translated: When they saw him, the pride they had in their own appearance was gone. They thought,🔽“

original: bdag cag gi slob dpon gyis 'di'i byad gzugs mngos pa dang / yon tan rnams bsngags pa las 'di'i byad gzugs de kho na bzhin du gyur pa las na /
analyzed: bdag cag gi slob dpon gyis 'di'i byad gzugs mngos pa dang / yon tan rnams bsngags pa las 'di'i byad gzugs de kho na bzhin du gyur pa las na /
translated: “Our teacher has described his physical appearance and praised his qualities. Since his physical appearance is exactly as described,

original: 'di'i yon tan rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du yod par nges kyi /
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du yod par nges kyi /
translated: it is certain that his qualities are also exactly as described.🔽We will give up living in our homes and practice pure conduct in his presence.”

original: bdag cag khyim na gnas pa btang la 'di nyid kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o snyam bsam nas de nyid kyi thad du rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: bdag cag khyim na gnas pa btang la 'di nyid kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o snyam bsam nas de nyid kyi thad du rab tu byung ste /
translated: Having thought this, they went forth in his presence.

original: de dag der rab tu byung nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
analyzed: de dag der rab tu byung nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
translated: Having gone forth, they generated the four meditative states and the five superknowledges.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: ji snyam du sems /🔽de'i tshe drang srong du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe drang srong du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: what do you think?

original: nga nyid yin no //🔽de'i tshe gzhon nu lnga brgyar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nga nyid yin no // de'i tshe gzhon nu lnga brgyar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The one who was that ṛṣi and practiced bodhisattva conduct at that time, on that occasion, was indeed me.

original: 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: The five hundred young men at that time, on that occasion, were indeed these five hundred bhikṣus.🔽“Bhikṣus,🔽at that time, on that occasion, I was the one who was the ṛṣi.

original: de'i tshe 'phong gi slob dpon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phong gi slob dpon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one who was the master of archery then

original: lhar bcas 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: lhar bcas 'di kho na yin te /
translated: is none other than Sahadeva.

original: de'i tshe'ang 'di rnams lhar bcas 'di kho na la brten te ngas dregs pa bcom nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod do //🔽da ltar yang 'di rnams lhar bcas kho na la brten te ngas g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe'ang 'di rnams lhar bcas 'di kho na la brten te ngas dregs pa bcom nas bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod do // da ltar yang 'di rnams lhar bcas kho na la brten te ngas g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
translated: At that time, too, after I had destroyed their pride, I established them in the four meditative states and the five superknowledges.

original: grub pa dang @335b bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod do //
analyzed: grub pa dang @335b bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod do //
translated: Now, too, after I had destroyed their pride, I established them in the unsurpassed, supreme welfare of nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la 'di dag thams cad rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la 'di dag thams cad rab tu byung ste /
translated: “Moreover, all of them went forth in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: der 'di rnams kyis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: der 'di rnams kyis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa /
translated: There, they practiced pure conduct all their lives, and at the time of their deaths, they prayed,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag cag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /

translated: May we please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next blessed buddha.🔽

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: “May we please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next blessed buddha.”

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par shog cig ces byas so //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par shog cig ces byas so // dge slong dag /
translated: “May we go forth in his doctrine alone, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship.”

original: ji snyam du sems /🔽de'i tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la rab tu byung ba dge slong lnga brgya po gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la rab tu byung ba dge slong lnga brgya po gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: da ltar rab tu byung ba 'di dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: da ltar rab tu byung ba 'di dag nyid yin te /

analyzed: de dag gis der rab tu byung nas tshe gcig gi bar du tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab ste /

analyzed: du byed par shog cig ces byas pa des na /

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /

analyzed: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so ////

translated: Then, with a mind full of faith in the Blessed One, he died and transmigrated. After his death, he was born in Śrāvastī in the home of a guild master. After nine or ten months had passed, a boy was born who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

translated: When he bumped into him, the water-pouring horn fell from the monk in charge of water’s hand and broke. The monk in charge of water became angry and said to the arhat,

original: 'di ni / glang dir po bzhin du che zhing tshor 'phrigs med pa zhig go /
analyzed: 'di ni / glang dir po bzhin du che zhing tshor 'phrigs med pa zhig go /
translated: “You’re as big as a bull but you have no sense of touch!”

original: zhes byas nas de'i tshig @338b de dgra bcom pa des thos nas des de phyogs gcig tu khrid de smras pa /
analyzed: zhes byas nas de'i tshig @338b de dgra bcom pa des thos nas des de phyogs gcig tu khrid de smras pa /
translated: When the arhat heard those words, he took the monk in charge of water to a secluded place and said to him,

original: btsun pa / khyod bdag su yin pa dang / nga su yin pa shes sam /🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: btsun pa / khyod bdag su yin pa dang / nga su yin pa shes sam / des smras pa /
translated: “Venerable, do you know who I am and who you are?”

original: ngas shes te /
analyzed: ngas shes te /
translated: “I know,” he said.🔽“You are a monk,

original: khyod kyang rab tu byung ba yin la /
analyzed: khyod kyang rab tu byung ba yin la /
translated: and I am an arhat.”

original: nga'ang rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nga'ang rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: I am also a renunciant.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: 'o bu cag rab tu byung bar 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: 'o bu cag rab tu byung bar 'dra mod kyi /
translated: “Although we are both renunciants,

original: khyod ni / bcing pa thams cad kyis bcings pa'i so so'i skye bo yin la /
analyzed: khyod ni / bcing pa thams cad kyis bcings pa'i so so'i skye bo yin la /
translated: you are an ordinary person bound by all fetters,

original: nga ni; 'ching ba thams cad las grol ba yin na /
analyzed: nga ni; 'ching ba thams cad las grol ba yin na /
translated: while I am free from all fetters.

original: khyod kyis tshig rtsub po smras kyi /🔽nyes pa la nyes so //
analyzed: khyod kyis tshig rtsub po smras kyi / nyes pa la nyes so //
translated: You spoke harsh words,

original: zhes bshags par gyis shig /
analyzed: zhes bshags par gyis shig /
translated: so you must confess your wrongdoing.

original: khyod 'khor ba na 'khor zhing mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnyed ta re zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyod 'khor ba na 'khor zhing mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnyed ta re zhes byas so //
translated: You will wander in saṃsāra and experience the fruits of unwholesome actions.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu dge slong de 'gyod pa chen po skyes te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu dge slong de 'gyod pa chen po skyes te /
translated: As soon as the monk heard this, he felt great remorse.

original: des dge slong de'i rkang pa la phyag btsal nas bzod pa gsol te /
analyzed: des dge slong de'i rkang pa la phyag btsal nas bzod pa gsol te /
translated: He bowed down at the feet of the monk and asked for forgiveness.

original: tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab pa /
translated: He practiced pure conduct all his life and at the time of his death, he made this aspiration:

original: bdag gis 'di 'dra ba'i yon gnas kyi mchog la tshig rtsub po smras pa'i las 'di ci nas kyang bdag la smin par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di 'dra ba'i yon gnas kyi mchog la tshig rtsub po smras pa'i las 'di ci nas kyang bdag la smin par ma gyur cig /
translated: “ ‘I have spoken harshly to such a supreme object of offerings. May this action not ripen on me!

original: 'di ltar bdag gis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan gyi tshogs ci'ang ma thob kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad kyang yon tan gyi tshogs ci'ang ma thob kyi /
translated: Although I have practiced pure conduct all my life, I have not attained any accumulation of qualities at all.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /🔽mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /🔽de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu @339a *//
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig / mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig / de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu @339a *//
translated: May I please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next buddha.

original: byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas so // dge slong dag /
translated: May I go forth in his doctrine alone, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship.’

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe chu'i zhal ta byed par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe chu'i zhal ta byed par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one who was the water supervisor then🔽is now the one who has gone forth.

original: dge tshul pha 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul pha 'di nyid yin te /
translated: He was the novice monk.

original: des der khros nas dgra bcom pa de la tshig rtsub po smras pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas tshe rabs lnga brgyar glang du skyes so //
analyzed: des der khros nas dgra bcom pa de la tshig rtsub po smras pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas tshe rabs lnga brgyar glang du skyes so //
translated: Because of the act of speaking harshly to the arhat in anger, he was reborn five hundred times as an ox.

original: des der tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab ste /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
analyzed: des der tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad nas 'chi khar smon lam btab ste / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma lung bstan pa gang yin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bdag gis mnyes par byed par gyur cig /
translated: He practiced pure conduct all his life, and at the time of his death, he prayed,

original: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig /
translated: ‘May I please and not displease Uttara, the young brahmin prophesied by the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa to be the next buddha.

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas pa des na /
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par gyur cig ces byas pa des na /
translated: May I go forth in his doctrine alone, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifest arhatship.’

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung dang shin tu mnyam pa dang / shugs mnyam pa dang / mdzad pa mnyam pa dang / thabs mnyam pa brnyes par gyur nas 'dis nga mnyes par byas te mi mnyes par ma byas la /

translated: Having pleased me, not displeased me,

analyzed: nga nyid kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so ////
translated: and gone forth in my very doctrine, he abandoned all the defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.”🔽The One Called Bhadda🔽The Story of Bhadda🔽The Story of Bhadda🔽The Story of Bhadda

analyzed: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas ming snying rje bzang po zhes btags so //
translated: At the elaborate feast celebrating his birth they named him Karuṇādatta.

original: de nas khye'u snying rje bzang po 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khu rnams kyis bskyed bsrings te /
analyzed: de nas khye'u snying rje bzang po 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang zhun mar dang mar gyi nying khu rnams kyis bskyed bsrings te /
translated: The child Karuṇādatta was reared on milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids,

analyzed: de gang gi tshe cher skyes pa de'i tshe khye'u de yi ge slob tu bcug ste rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po rnams kyi bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas tha dad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: and when he had grown, he was taught letters and all the different crafts and occupations of a royal lineage, such as

original: glang po che zhon pa dang / rta zhon pa dang / mtshon cha bcang ba dang / 'pho ba dang / mdun du bsnur ba dang / phyir bsnur ba dang / g-yul las 'byung bar bya ba dang / lcags kyu bzung ba dang / zhags pa gzung ba dang /
analyzed: glang po che zhon pa dang / rta zhon pa dang / mtshon cha bcang ba dang / 'pho ba dang / mdun du bsnur ba dang / phyir bsnur ba dang / g-yul las 'byung bar bya ba dang / lcags kyu bzung ba dang / zhags pa gzung ba dang /
translated: how to ride an elephant, how to ride horseback, how to wield a weapon, how to advance, how to retreat, how to behave in battle, how to arrest with a noose, and how to shoot an arrow.

original: mda' bo che 'phang ba dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'phang ba dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa gdab pa dang / 'khor lo 'phang ba dang / gcad pa dang / gsheg pa dang / lag pas gzung ba dang / rkang pa'i stabs dang /
analyzed: mda' bo che 'phang ba dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa 'phang ba dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa gdab pa dang / 'khor lo 'phang ba dang / gcad pa dang / gsheg pa dang / lag pas gzung ba dang / rkang pa'i stabs dang /
translated: He was trained in shooting the great Indian bow, in shooting the single-pronged vajra, in throwing the single-edged spear, in throwing the discus, in cutting, in shaving, in holding with the hand, in the gait of walking,

original: mgo bo bskyab pa dang / rgyang mar 'phang ba dang / sgra grag par 'phang ba dang / gnad du 'phang ba dang / gdon mi za bar phog par bya ba @340a *//
analyzed: mgo bo bskyab pa dang / rgyang mar 'phang ba dang / sgra grag par 'phang ba dang / gnad du 'phang ba dang / gdon mi za bar phog par bya ba @340a *//
translated: in protecting the head, in shooting from a distance, in shooting with a loud noise, in shooting at the vital parts, in shooting to be sure of hitting,

original: dang / tshabs cher gtang ba rnams kyang bslabs nas gnas lnga la byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: dang / tshabs cher gtang ba rnams kyang bslabs nas gnas lnga la byang bar gyur to //
translated: and in shooting with great force. He became skilled in these five areas.

original: de nas dam grangs te 'phyon ma rnams la yang zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas dam grangs te 'phyon ma rnams la yang zhugs so //
translated: Then he broke his vows and had intercourse with prostitutes.

original: phyis re zhig na de phas mdza' sde'i khrod du btang nas mdza' sde de dag dpyid kyi dus su shing grib me tog rgyas pa /
analyzed: phyis re zhig na de phas mdza' sde'i khrod du btang nas mdza' sde de dag dpyid kyi dus su shing grib me tog rgyas pa /
translated: Later, his father sent him to a friend’s house. That friend had a garden with trees in full bloom in the spring.

original: ne tso dang ri skegs dang rma bya dang khu byug dang shang shang te'u rnams skad 'byin pa'i skyed mos tshal gyi nags khrod du smad tshong ma'i gtso mo khrid de song nas de dag de na 'khod pa las smad tshong ma'i phyir 'thab mo byung ste khye'u
analyzed: ne tso dang ri skegs dang rma bya dang khu byug dang shang shang te'u rnams skad 'byin pa'i skyed mos tshal gyi nags khrod du smad tshong ma'i gtso mo khrid de song nas de dag de na 'khod pa las smad tshong ma'i phyir 'thab mo byung ste khye'u
translated: The young man

original: snying rje bzang po khros pas mdza' sde gsum bsad nas mdza' sde rnams dong ste sde dpon sengge la smras so //
analyzed: snying rje bzang po khros pas mdza' sde gsum bsad nas mdza' sde rnams dong ste sde dpon sengge la smras so //
translated: Sādhumatī became angry and killed three of the friends. The friends left and told the general Siṃha.

original: de nas sde dpon sengges de thos nas bu de bu ma yin par bsgrags te khyim nas kyang bskrad do //
analyzed: de nas sde dpon sengges de thos nas bu de bu ma yin par bsgrags te khyim nas kyang bskrad do //
translated: Then, when the general Siṃha heard that, he proclaimed that the young man was not his son and expelled him from the house.

original: de nas yangs pa can gyi li tsa b'i rnams kyis de gsod du btang ste ka ra bi ra'i me tog gi phreng bas mgul ba dkris nas gshed ma la gtad de gshed ma'i mi gos sngon po bgos la ral gri phyung ste rnga sgra drag po sgrog
analyzed: de nas yangs pa can gyi li tsa b'i rnams kyis de gsod du btang ste ka ra bi ra'i me tog gi phreng bas mgul ba dkris nas gshed ma la gtad de gshed ma'i mi gos sngon po bgos la ral gri phyung ste rnga sgra drag po sgrog
translated: Then the Licchavis of Vaiśālī sent him to be killed. They tied a garland of karavīra flowers around his neck, handed him over to the executioners, and the executioners, dressed in blue, unsheathed their swords and beat the loud war drum.

original: pa dag gis khrid nas lam po che'i mdo rnams su bsgrags te gsad pa'i sar phyin tu nye ba dang / de srog gi phyir 'jigs shing skrag nas phan tshun du lta ste /
analyzed: pa dag gis khrid nas lam po che'i mdo rnams su bsgrags te gsad pa'i sar phyin tu nye ba dang / de srog gi phyir 'jigs shing skrag nas phan tshun du lta ste /
translated: The executioners led him to the main road and announced him. As they approached the place of execution, he was terrified and looked around,

original: bdag phongs shing dkos thag pa dang sdug pa'i skyabs byed pa dang / srog phangs pa sbyin pa su zhig yod cig gu snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag phongs shing dkos thag pa dang sdug pa'i skyabs byed pa dang / srog phangs pa sbyin pa su zhig yod cig gu snyam mo //
translated: thinking, “Who can be my refuge, my protector, and my defender, who can give me my life and save me from this great calamity?”

original: @340b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /
analyzed: @340b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ston pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Teacher of the One Path,

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi shes bya dang ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi shes bya dang ye shes la mnga' brnyes pa /
translated: the One who has mastered the two kinds of knowledge of knowable objects,

original: ma 'dres  pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres  pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: the One who is skilled in the three kinds of unique mindfulness,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhis mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis mi 'jigs pa /
translated: the One who is fearless with the four kinds of fearlessness,

original: 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba las rnam par grol ba /
translated: the One who is free from the five kinds of rebirth,

original: skye mched drug la mkhas pa /
analyzed: skye mched drug la mkhas pa /
translated: the One who is skilled in the six sense bases,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod yul ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod yul ba /
translated: the One who has the seven branches of enlightenment as his domain,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa /
translated: the One who is absorbed in the eight liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: They are absorbed in the nine successive absorptions.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: They are endowed with the power of the ten powers.

original: yang dag pa'i sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa rnams ni /🔽chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa rnams ni / chos nyid kyis nyin dus gsum /
translated: They roar the great lion’s roar of perfect buddhahood.

original: mtshan dus gsum ste nyin mtshan dus drug tu sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te /🔽su ni / rgud /
analyzed: mtshan dus gsum ste nyin mtshan dus drug tu sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs te / su ni / rgud /
translated: It is by nature that they look out over the world with the eyes of the buddhas three times during the day and three times during the night, six times in the course of a day and night.🔽Who is declining?

original: su ni; dar /🔽su ni / phongs shing 'dug /
analyzed: su ni; dar / su ni / phongs shing 'dug /
translated: Who is flourishing?🔽Who is in distress?

original: su ni / nyam nga bar gyur /🔽su ni / gnod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: su ni / nyam nga bar gyur / su ni / gnod pa dang ldan /
translated: Who is in a difficult situation?🔽Who is in a difficult situation and in distress?

original: su ni / phongs pa dang nyam nga ba dang gnod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: su ni / phongs pa dang nyam nga ba dang gnod pa dang ldan /
translated: Who is in a difficult situation, in distress, and in pain?

original: su ni / ngan song du gzhol /🔽su ni; ngan song du 'bab /
analyzed: su ni / ngan song du gzhol / su ni; ngan song du 'bab /
translated: Who is heading toward the lower realms?🔽Who is falling into the lower realms?

original: su ni / ngan song du bab /
analyzed: su ni / ngan song du bab /
translated: Who has fallen into the lower realms?

original: su ni / ngas ngan song nas phyung ste mtho ris dang thar ba dang 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
analyzed: su ni / ngas ngan song nas phyung ste mtho ris dang thar ba dang 'bras bu la gzhag par bya /
translated: Whom should I pull out of the lower realms and establish in the higher realms, in liberation, and in the fruits?

original: su ni / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
analyzed: su ni / nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba las lag nas drang bar bya /
translated: Whom should I pull out of the mire of bad actions?

original: su ni / 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya /🔽su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma @341a *//
analyzed: su ni / 'phags pa'i nor bdun med pa las 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du gzhug par bya / su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma @341a *//
translated: Who should I establish in the lordship of the seven riches of the noble ones, which they do not have?

original: bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
analyzed: bskyed pa las bskyed par bya /
translated: Who should I cause to plant roots of virtue, which they have not planted?

original: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya /
analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa las yongs su smin par bya /
translated: Who should I ripen in planted roots of virtue?

original: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin zin pa las ye shes kyi mtshon gyis brtol bar bya /🔽su la ni /
analyzed: su ni / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin zin pa las ye shes kyi mtshon gyis brtol bar bya / su la ni /
translated: Who should I pierce with the spear of wisdom in ripened roots of virtue?

analyzed: gnod sbyin nag po'ang bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du btul na lags lags so // zhes gsol to //
translated: If the Blessed One would also subdue the black yakṣa out of compassion, that would be excellent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po'i khab kyi mi rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin de rdzu 'phrul gyis bkug nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po'i khab kyi mi rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin de rdzu 'phrul gyis bkug nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One assented to the people of Rājagṛha by remaining silent. The Blessed One then magically summoned the yakṣa and said,

original: kye / sems can rnams la gnod pa ma byed cig /
analyzed: kye / sems can rnams la gnod pa ma byed cig /
translated: Oh! Do not harm sentient beings.

original: sdig pa'i las 'di thong zhig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las 'di thong zhig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Abandon this sinful action.

original: des gsol pa /
analyzed: des gsol pa /
translated: He replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la ji ltar bka' stsal pa de bzhin du 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la ji ltar bka' stsal pa de bzhin du 'tshal lo //
translated: I will do as the Blessed One has instructed.

original: zhes gsol nas bcom ldan 'das las skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi blangs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: zhes gsol nas bcom ldan 'das las skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi blangs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having said that, he took refuge in the Bhagavān and took the bases of training. Then he said this:

original: btsun pa / deng slan chad bdag gis rgyal po'i khab kyi mi rnams la bsrung ba dang bskyab par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: btsun pa / deng slan chad bdag gis rgyal po'i khab kyi mi rnams la bsrung ba dang bskyab par 'tshal lo //
translated: “Lord, from now on I will protect and care for the people of Rājagṛha.”

original: zhes gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song nas de rang gi gnas su 'dug go /
analyzed: zhes gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song nas de rang gi gnas su 'dug go /
translated: Having said that, he bowed his head at the Bhagavān’s feet and went to the Bhagavān. He sat down in his own place.

original: de de na 'dug nas bsam pa /
analyzed: de de na 'dug nas bsam pa /
translated: While he was sitting there, he thought,

original: drang srong nag po de dka' thub don med pa 'dis nyon mongs pa'i steng du zhag bdun na 'chi bar mthong nas de de la snying brtse ba'i phyir de'i thad @350a *//🔽du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: drang srong nag po de dka' thub don med pa 'dis nyon mongs pa'i steng du zhag bdun na 'chi bar mthong nas de de la snying brtse ba'i phyir de'i thad @350a *// du song ste smras pa /
translated: “That ṛṣi Kṛṣṇa is practicing a pointless austerity. He will die in seven days because of his affliction.” He went to him

original: drang srong / khyod kyi dka' thub drag po 'di ci dgos /
analyzed: drang srong / khyod kyi dka' thub drag po 'di ci dgos /
translated: and said, “Ṛṣi, what is the use of this severe austerity of yours?

original: de'i steng du khyod da ste zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes byas so //
analyzed: de'i steng du khyod da ste zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes byas so //
translated: In addition, you will die in seven days.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu brang srong de sdug bsngal chen po skyes nas de mya ngan gyi dbang gis rdzu 'phrul de las nyams te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu brang srong de sdug bsngal chen po skyes nas de mya ngan gyi dbang gis rdzu 'phrul de las nyams te /
translated: Because of his grief, he lost his magical power.

original: de gzhi de las lhag par mya ngan skyes nas shin tu smre sngags 'don cing 'dug go /
analyzed: de gzhi de las lhag par mya ngan skyes nas shin tu smre sngags 'don cing 'dug go /
translated: He became even more sorrowful on that basis and remained there, lamenting.

original: de nas gnod sbyin des smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin des smras pa /
translated: Then the yakṣa said,

original: drang srong / ha cang mya ngan ma byed /🔽nyon mongs par ma byed /
analyzed: drang srong / ha cang mya ngan ma byed / nyon mongs par ma byed /
translated: “Sage, don’t be so sad!🔽Don’t be distressed!

original: smre sngags 'don par ma byed /
analyzed: smre sngags 'don par ma byed /
translated: Don’t lament!

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One is staying in Rājagṛha.

original: de ni / 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam mkhyen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni / 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam mkhyen pa yin gyi /
translated: He knows the path to death.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su song zhig dang / des na khyod la legs pa thams cad mdzad par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su song zhig dang / des na khyod la legs pa thams cad mdzad par 'gyur ro // zhes byas so //
translated: Go for refuge to the Blessed Buddha, and he will do everything that is good for you.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu drang srong nag pos thams cad spangs te 'od ma'i tshal du song ngo //
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu drang srong nag pos thams cad spangs te 'od ma'i tshal du song ngo //
translated: As soon as he heard that, the sage Kātyāyana gave up everything and went to the Bamboo Grove.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te chos ston to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te chos ston to //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was seated in the midst of a retinue of hundreds, teaching the Dharma.

original: de nas drang srong nag pos thag ring po zhig nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
analyzed: de nas drang srong nag pos thag ring po zhig nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
translated: Then the sage Kṛṣṇa, from a distance, saw the Blessed Buddha, his body well adorned and beautified with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu /
translated: like a fire in the shape of a human body,

original: me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
translated: like a flame of fire anointed with ghee,

original: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
analyzed: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
translated: like a lamp placed in a golden vessel,

original: @350b mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis sbras pa lta bu /
analyzed: @350b mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis sbras pa lta bu /
translated: like a sacrificial post inlaid with various jewels,

original: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: the Blessed Buddha, clear-minded, stainless, and pure.

original: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
translated: Having seen him, he gave rise to supreme joy.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: The bliss of sentient beings who have accumulated roots of virtue upon first seeing the Buddha is such that

original: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la gom spar byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la gom spar byas pa la'ang nyams bde ba de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one were to strive for the mind of serenity for twelve years, such bliss would not arise.

original: de ltar mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur to //
translated: Having seen this, he became very pleased with the Blessed One.

original: de dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: de dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: Having become pleased, he went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having understood his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: des na des stan de kho na la 'dug bzhin du bden pa mthong ba'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: des na des stan de kho na la 'dug bzhin du bden pa mthong ba'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /
translated: Then, while sitting right there, he manifested the fruit of non-returner by seeing the truths.

original: des bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen the truths, he rose from his seat, drew down the right shoulder of his upper garment, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and requested the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / bdag legs par @351a *//
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag legs par @351a *//
translated: “Lord,

original: gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: if permitted I wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete my novitiate, and achieve full ordination.

original: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: May I too, under the Blessed One, practice pure conduct all my life.”

original: de nas de bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
analyzed: de nas de bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de la lung yang phog go /
translated: The Blessed One then gave him the going forth, saying, “Come, join me, monk,” and he conferred on him full ordination and the precepts of novice monkhood.

original: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: des kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: He then applied himself diligently, energetically, and resolutely, and cast off all afflictive emotions, realizing arhatship.

original: de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa dang / nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa dang / nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He became an arhat free from the attachment of the three realms, equal minded toward gold and filth, with a mind like space or the palm of his hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: He became an arhat, free from the passions of the three realms, equal toward gold and manure, with an attitude like the earth, his mind and thoughts like space, his heart cooled like sandalwood.

original: rig bas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig bas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: He had destroyed the shell,

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: had attained knowledge, insight, and wisdom,

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: was not concerned with gain, passion, or praise,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: and had become an object of offering, veneration, and respectful address for Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the monks requested the Blessed Buddha,

original: btsun pa / drang srong 'di 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te bcom @351b ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung nas g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: btsun pa / drang srong 'di 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te bcom @351b ldan 'das kyis rab tu phyung nas g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
translated: “Lord, this sage, terrified of death, came to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One ordained him.

original: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhags la gzigs /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhags la gzigs /
translated: Look how he has attained the final state of well-being, the transcendence of suffering.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: “Not only now,

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i dus na'ang 'di nyid 'chi bas 'jigs skrag nas ngas rab tu phyung ste bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa de nyon cig /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i dus na'ang 'di nyid 'chi bas 'jigs skrag nas ngas rab tu phyung ste bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa de nyon cig /
translated: but also in the past, this one, terrified of death, was ordained by me and established in the four meditative states and the five superknowledges. Listen well!

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na dka' thub kyi gnas shig na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na dka' thub kyi gnas shig na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: in the past, in a certain hermitage, there lived a sage who possessed the five superknowledges,

original: rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba zhig gnas pa de'i slob ma bram ze'i khye'u le lo can tshe thung du zhig yod de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba zhig gnas pa de'i slob ma bram ze'i khye'u le lo can tshe thung du zhig yod de /
translated: who had great magical power and great influence. He had a student, a young brahmin who was lazy and short-lived.

original: des de la lung phog kyang de le lo che ba'i phyir sgrim du mi btub bo //
analyzed: des de la lung phog kyang de le lo che ba'i phyir sgrim du mi btub bo //
translated: Although he gave him the transmission, because the young man was so lazy, he could not concentrate.

original: de nas phyi zhig na drang srong des bltas nas bram ze'i khye'u de zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur bar mthong la /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na drang srong des bltas nas bram ze'i khye'u de zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur bar mthong la /
translated: Then, after some time, the sage looked and saw that the young brahmin would die after seven days.

original: des ci'ang ma thob par rig nas des de skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des ci'ang ma thob par rig nas des de skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Knowing that he had not attained anything, in order to generate regret in him, he said,

original: bram ze'i khye'u /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u /
translated: “Young brahmin!

original: le lo ma byed cig /
analyzed: le lo ma byed cig /
translated: Don’t be lazy!

original: khyod zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyod zhag bdun na 'chi bar 'gyur ro // zhes byas so //
translated: You will die after seven days.”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze'i khye'u de shin tu mi dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze'i khye'u de shin tu mi dga' bar gyur te /
translated: As soon as he heard that, the young brahmin became very unhappy.

original: mi dga' bar gyur pa des na bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
analyzed: mi dga' bar gyur pa des na bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga bskyed do //
translated: Because of that unhappiness, he generated the four meditative states and the five superknowledges.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /🔽de'i tshe drang srong du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe drang srong du gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: what do you think?

original: nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: nga nyid yin no //
translated: The one who was the sage abiding in the conduct of a bodhisattva at that time, on that occasion, was indeed me.🔽“Monks,

original: de'i tshe @352a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe @352a *//
translated: at that time,

original: bram ze'i khye'ur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'ur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The one who was the young brahmin then

original: nag po 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: nag po 'di kho na yin te /
translated: is none other than this Kāla.

original: de'i tshe'ang 'di 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag nas des bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bzhag go /🔽da ltar yang 'di 'chi bas 'jigs skrag nas ngas rab tu phyung ste g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe'ang 'di 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag nas des bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bzhag go / da ltar yang 'di 'chi bas 'jigs skrag nas ngas rab tu phyung ste g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
translated: At that time, too, he was terrified of death, and I established him in the four meditative states and five superknowledges.

original: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhag go /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhag go /
translated: Now, too, he was terrified of death, and I gave him ordination and established him in the unsurpassed, supreme welfare of nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la 'di rab tu byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi gsung rab la 'di rab tu byung bar gyur te /
translated: “Moreover, he went forth in the doctrine of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa,

original: der 'dis cho gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa dang / dbang lo yongs su smin par byad pa des na /
analyzed: der 'dis cho gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa dang / dbang lo yongs su smin par byad pa des na /
translated: and there he practiced pure conduct all his life, and by bringing his faculties to full maturity

original: da ltar rnam par grol bar gyur to;;/
analyzed: da ltar rnam par grol bar gyur to;;/
translated: he has now been liberated.”

original: /mda' thogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /mda' thogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Story of Śaraṇadāsa

original: yul ser skya'i gnas na sh'akya dbyug thogs zhes bya ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: yul ser skya'i gnas na sh'akya dbyug thogs zhes bya ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
translated: In the land of Kapilavastu, there was a man named Śākya Daṇḍapāṇi who was wealthy, had many possessions, and enjoyed great wealth.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /
translated: He had vast and extensive property.
